Risks and challenges
This is our 20th Kickstarter Campaign, and there are usually some vague areas in terms of timing when it comes to anything normally produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays
Due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards later than others, but this is normal as with all Kickstarter campaigns.

We know what it takes to print a BIG & EPIC Product - Such as: Big Trouble in Little China the Game, Rambo: the Board Game, and Secrets of the Lost Tomb, and more! That means we have produced an astounding amount of different boxes of game products for our past campaigns and always deliver our products to our backers!

We endeavor to please our backers in any way we can! We want you to enjoy our games, our stories, and our creations to their fullest. If there is anything that we can ever do to make your experience better, we're always here to help!

Our Motto is "Of the Gamer, by the Gamer, and For the Gamer!"

We know what it's like to be Ignored by Project Creators (We've backed nearly 300 campaigns), to never get an email back from a Game Company, to have to post on a blog to get a response... We're not Like that... Here's the Owner of our Company's email... Chris@EverythingEpic.us you can email him directly for anything you ever need and he will always respond to you directly to help as soon as possible!

campaign.story:
The sky is darker, the tea is colder, and the worst is still to come…
This campaign includes these three gloomy goodies:
 Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall standalone card game
 Gloom Grief Case deluxe storage box
 The Gloom Chronicles campaign-style mini-expansion
Misery and mysteries abound at Hemlock Hall, the imposing estate of Lord Wellington-Smythe and his eccentric family of misfits. When you’re invited inside for an evening’s entertainment, what could possibly go wrong? Will you Cuddle with Cats or Thwart a Thief? Will you Brawl Over Brandy or Fall Prey to the Plague? At Hemlock Hall, awful amusements become deadly diversions with the flip of a card.
Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall is a darkly humorous stand-alone competitive storytelling card game for two to five players. To win, you make your characters suffer the greatest tragedies possible before passing on to the well-deserved respite of death.  The player with the most negative score wins. And in Gloomier, the winner gets the final word: Who was the murderer? How did the heist end? You decide!
Gloomier features transparent plastic cards, allowing a character’s score — and story — to evolve as cards are stacked on top of each other. You don’t need prior experience to play Gloomier, but Gloom fans will find that A Night at Hemlock Hall expands the storytelling aspect of Gloom with new, specially-designed story prompts. And this full stand-alone game includes 6 new Stories and 14 new Guests that can be used with any edition of Gloom. So dare to enter Hemlock Hall, and see what delightful disaster awaits!

Like all Gloom games, Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall is a storytelling game. Stack transparent cards to boost your score and make your characters’ tales the most tragic — while blighting opponents with good fortune. Then, tell the story of these miserable misanthropes.
When you play an Untimely Death card on a character, they die and their negative score is locked in, but the story continues until all of one player’s characters have perished. Then, all players tally their scores.The player whose characters had the most tragic lives (and the most negative score) is the winner.
Points are important, but the best part of Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall is building increasingly sad, and increasingly silly stories with your fellow players. If you like Nightmare Before Christmas, The Addams Family, or A Series of Unfortunate Events, we think you’ll enjoy the absurd dark humor of Gloomier.

Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall contains:
 110 transparent plastic cards (including 14 new Guests, 6 Story cards, a new cast of Characters, and a variety of new Modifier, Event, and Untimely Death cards to bolster your tragic tales)
A 12-page, color, totally redesigned rulebook 
An attractive tuckbox 
It’s a standalone expansion, which means you can play it by itself or combine it with any other Gloom games.

Gloom fans have been asking for it for years, and it’s finally here … a box big enough for all your Gloom games!
The luxurious Grief Case is large enough to hold every Gloom game produced thus far — that’s roughly 1500 Gloom cards — plus all your rules and extras, and your darkest secrets. (It’s even got room to accommodate another four full Gloom games or eight expansions, for when you add future Gloom games to your collection.)
This case is extremely sturdy! 4mm thick laminated chipboard will make this the strongest game box in your collection, sure to hold up to a lifetime of use. Or, of course, 'til Untimely Death.
 Soft Touch finish adds a luxurious velvety-soft texture for instant tactile appeal and resistance to fingerprint marks. It also makes sliding the lid off the box both quick and satisfying.
 Spot gloss and red metallic foil add texture and shine to highlight design elements.
This deluxe box comes with its own thick acrylic dividers, so you can sort and cross-reference your games and cards in whatever way makes the most sense to you.
And more! Follow our backer updates for behind-the-scenes looks while we finalize production.
design subject to change
And don’t worry, if you’re missing a few Gloom games, we’ve made them all available as add-ons for this campaign so you can easily complete your collection!


Lots of Kickstarter campaigns (including several of ours!) have lots of different stretch goals to unlock. For this Kickstarter, we’re focusing on just one big one: The Gloom Chronicles. Chronicles is an expansion for the Gloom series, turning Gloom into a serialized, campaign-style game. It is included with all pledge levels, and has been improved through stretch goals to be the best The Gloom Chronicles it can be!
In Gloom, you and your friends weave tales of woe. But where does the story begin? Each card in The Gloom Chronicles expansion starts a new chapter for an ongoing game of Gloom, ties those games together as a serialized campaign, and adds variant rules, bringing new challenges to the story. You can choose a card at random, or you can start from the beginning and explore the ongoing chronicle of your family through an extended campaign. Your story begins with the Unhappy Birthday … but will your next game of Gloom involve a Tragic Train Ride, or will you end up at the infamous World’s Unfair?
The Gloom Chronicles is an expansion that can enhance any game of Gloom. You can use it with just one Gloom game, or let it navigate you through all the expansions. Narrative prompts give players a unified foundation for their stories, while variant rules challenge new and experienced players alike. The Unhappy Birthday awaits! What ignominious ending will your Gloom Chronicle have?

All pledge levels receive a discount on the entire Gloom line of products to complete your collection.
 The stretch goals for this campaign improved and expanded The Gloom Chronicles to its best version! Thank you for your support!
SINGLE ADD-ONS: This campaign’s Add-Ons page in checkout will let you pick up the game or two you missed, hassle free. They’re in stock and will ship very soon after the close of the campaign, before the main campaign rewards.
COMBINED SHIPPING: If you’re ordering more add-ons, visit our web store for savings on combined shipping. Just use the backer-only code posted in Update #2 when you check out. Products ordered via our web store ship immediately!


As a game, Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall is complete. Its rules have been extensively tested, the art and layout are finished, it just needs final proofreading before going to press. Work on The Gloom Chronicles and the Gloom Grief Case is also well underway. 
Our updates to backers will feature this handy chart to keep you informed on our progress at every step along the way:
Shipping is paid on checkout. Kickstarter will calculate the shipping and tax for your destination country when you back the project. If your country isn’t listed in the dropdown menu in Kickstarter’s checkout, and you’re interested in backing A Night at Hemlock Hall, please reach out to us at crowdfund@atlas-games.com and we’ll see if we can help.
The "shipping" charge includes applicable taxes like VAT or GST in the Canada, the UK and the EU. In other countries you may be liable for taxes and fees charged at the border. Whenever possible we use “Delivery Duty Paid” (DDP) services, so international packages shouldn’t be delayed at customs or flagged for extra fees. Backing our project on Kickstarter is not a useful way to avoid paying your local government’s taxes.
We ship your rewards ourselves. Rewards will ship from the Atlas Games warehouse in Duluth, Minnesota, USA. Based on our experience, this is more reliable and ultimately less expensive than a collection of global partners. In part due to our direct control of this facility, our shipping operations have remained both open and safe during the global pandemic.
Retailers get their usual terms. Retail tier backers pay shipping later, if at all, using Atlas Games’ standard direct-to-retail sales terms for shipping. See “Unruly Retailers,” below.
We believe that healthy retailers are key to a healthy hobby. We have a reputation for taking care of our retailer partners, and our Kickstarter campaigns are no exception. This campaign is retail-friendly because:
 The discount is what you expect. Your pledge gives you dollar-for-dollar credit to buy whatever mix of Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall, The Gloom Chronicles, and the Gloom Grief Case that are right for your store, at our standard retailer discount (50%) and regular shipping terms.
 Exclusive access to the Gloom Grief Case. This deluxe game box will not be made available through distribution.
 One free copy of The Gloom Chronicles, fully improved and expanded by the stretch goals of this campaign. Purchase more at your regular discount.
 Retail-only stretch goal. If 100 retail stores back this campaign, each one will receive a free demo copy of Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall. (As a point of reference, 124 retailers backed our last Gloom campaign!)
 Personal attention for ordering. Our salesperson will contact you to take your order, no need to worry about ordering add-ons now in Kickstarter.
 Immediate sales. Retailer backers may sell products from this Kickstarter as soon as they receive their orders.
 Gloom is a fan favorite. It’s one of our all-time best selling games, with over 350,000 copies sold and translations in 9 languages. Gloom is a proven winner for your store!
Any retailer questions can be directed to travis@atlas-games.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At Atlas Games we’ve delivered seven Kickstarter campaigns, with our eighth manufactured and pending fulfillment. We invite you to visit the campaign pages for Feng Shui 2, Unknown Armies 3, Cogs and Commissars, Over the Edge 3, The White Box, Magical Kitties Save the Day, and Dice Miner to get a sense of how we deliver on our promises. We’d call your attention especially to the backer updates for Magical Kitties Save the Day, to give you a sense of how we handle things when the unexpected arises. Beyond our previous Kickstarters, Atlas Games has been publishing tabletop games and making good on our promises for 30 years.

At the same time: Yes, indeed, many things seem very uncertain these days. There are definitely risks that COVID-19 will disrupt our supply chain or affect our staff members. We promise that as challenges arise we will be transparent, plan sensible solutions, and keep you informed. If you have questions or concerns about Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall, please contact us at crowdfund (at) atlas-games.com. Thank you for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Gloom cards are plastic, and very durable, for a lifetime of play.

The Grief Case is made from 4mm thick, laminated chipboard, making it one of the most durable game boxes you'll find, sure to last a lifetime. It's also future-proofed, with plenty of room for the Gloom games we have yet to make.
Reusability and recyclability
The Grief Case is the last Gloom box you'll ever need, and the tuckboxes that the individual games came in are fully recyclable.
Sustainable materials
We don't use shrink-wrap anymore, now individual decks are either banded with a paper band or held together with its box. Game boxes are kept closed with a small sticker.

Surveys and Shipping

Shipping Updates

Most of the first wave shipments have gone out.  There are less than 500 still in the works and should be delivered in the next few weeks. Our warehouse is a bit overwhelmed right now but we have added more staff and are working hard to get your orders to you!

updates.update_userinfo: Gloomier, May You Rest in Peace 🪦
updates.update_content:
This afternoon we laid the Gloomier: A Night at Hemlock Hall campaign to rest.  We cannot thank you enough for your kinds words, input, and excitement over this gloomy sequel. 

Some Highlights
All stretch goals achieved, making The Gloom Chronicles the best it can be! 
Play Now!

Hi, folks! Thank you so much for your support. It's really overwhelming. Thankfully we have some dreary, rainy weather here in Minnesota this week to keep us grounded.
As we close in on the end of the campaign, we wanted to repeat some important information for backers.

First, we are not using a pledge manager.

updates.update_userinfo: Gloomier's Final Days & Upgrade Sneak Peeks
updates.update_content:
Gorgeous Gloom Grief Case Dividers
Several of you have asked what goodies we'll be including in the Gloom Grief Case. Kyla McT has been working hard on graphic design, and has come up with a gorgeous and extremely useful design for the dividers, featuring the eye-catching art from Gloom and its expansions. That's right, we're going to be printing in gloriously gloomy color straight on the dividers!

updates.update_userinfo: The Best Chronicles, Thanks to You!
updates.update_content:
Who needs Stretch Goals?!
To heck with stretch goals, you guys blew us away!!!  
Our plan was to announce foil cards for The Gloom Chronicles at $250K but your support has already surpassed that! So instead of stretching things out further, we’re just going to make The Gloom Chronicles in the coolest format we can think of for all of you - and so it will have twenty, tarot-sized, foil-enhanced cards! Details and images to come.

updates.update_userinfo: Your Fate is in the Cards
updates.update_content:
This campaign has been going for 72 hours and we are blown away by your response! 
Stretch Goal Met
We just crossed the $100K! This means The Gloom Chronicles will be tarot-sized!  The pack will still include 20 cards. These larger cards have room for bigger art, and bigger text. So the "special rules" that stay in effect for a chapter of Chronicles will be easier to read from across the table, in case you need a reminder mid-game. And, remember, the tarot-sized will still fit in the Grief Case.
Announcing Next Stretch Goal on March 19th

Double the Chronicles 
This morning we crossed the $60,000 mark, unlocking our second stretch goal. This means The Gloom Chronicles will now have ten additional cards! Every backer will receive a booster pack of 20 cards that will help you along your Gloomy journey.

Next Goal at $100K

Tabletop Tycoon will donate a game to Toys for Tots for each copy of Newleaf, Mistwood, and The Complete Collection sold through this campaign. To date, as a company, we’ve raised enough to donate over 75,000 games to kids prior to the start of this campaign. In this campaign, your support has allowed us to raise enough to donate over 40,000 games to kids (and growing as we add more backers!)
Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
New critters and new ideas are arriving every day at the Newleaf train station! Being the first official city of Everdell, Newleaf has grown into a thriving destination with numerous exciting opportunities to discover and explore. Attract eager visitors to your city, make your reservations, travel further with tickets, and build the most prosperous city Everdell has ever seen! Prepare to experience an all-new Everdell that will keep delighting and surprising you for many more seasons to come.
Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
Lurking in the depths of Mistwood, the cunning and villainous Nightweave plots to take over Everdell with the aid of her spiderlings. Pit your wits against Nightweave and her sticky schemes in both solo and two-player games, and recruit heroes of yore from our More Legends and Corrin Evertail expansion packs as well as transform your farms with our new Through Every Season expansion pack!

Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
Dive tailfirst into the world of Everdell with the Complete Collection. Build a city of critters and constructions and explore the Emerald Valley and beyond; celebrate the Bellfaire, wonder at Newleaf’s mechanical marvels, trek into the Spirecrest Mountains, explore the underwater depths of Pearlbrook, and chance the dangers of Mistwood. Play against automated opponents including the dastardly Rugwort and cunning Nightweave, meet heroes of renown in our Legends II and Corrin Evertail expansion packs, and find abundance in new farms in our Through Every Season expansion pack. Everdell is easy to learn, yet offers satisfying strategic depth and endless replayability.

Will the sun shine brightest on your city?
Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.

New to Everdell?
Check out this great How to Play video from Watch it Played!
Within the charming valley of Everdell, beneath the boughs of towering trees, among meandering streams and mossy hollows, a civilization of forest critters is thriving and expanding... Everdell is a game of dynamic tableau building and worker placement played over four seasons. Whoever makes the most impressive city wins! 

On your turn, you can take one of three actions:
a) Place a Meeple: You have a collection of wooden Critter meeples. You can place these on the board locations, events, and on Destination cards. Critter meeples allow you to perform various actions to develop your city: gathering resources, drawing cards, and taking other special actions.
b) Play a Card: Each player is building and populating a city; a tableau of up to 15 Construction and Critter cards. There are five types of cards: Travelers, Production, Destination, Governance, and Prosperity. Cards generate resources (twigs, resin, pebbles, and berries), grant abilities, and ultimately score points. The interactions of the cards reveal numerous strategies and a near infinite variety of working cities.
c) Prepare for the next Season: Critter meeples are returned to your supply and you gain bonuses depending on the season. The game is played from one year’s winter through to the end of autumn. Players add up the points from their cards and other bonuses and whoever has the highest total wins!
New content that will delight and surprise you for many more seasons to come!
Golden Occupied Tokens
The new Critter and Construction cards in Newleaf are played like normal Critter and Construction cards from the base game, except that you use Golden Occupied tokens instead of normal occupied tokens. These Golden Occupied tokens are limited -- a player can never use more than 3 in a game! These new cards are very powerful, so choose wisely which you'll spend your Golden Occupied tokens on! 

Through Every Season Cards
Since the beginning of Everdell’s history, farming has been a vital part of the valley’s way of life. Farmers face a number of challenges through the four distinct seasons of the year and must adapt as the weather changes. Experience the story of an Everdell farm throughout the year!
The 8 new special Farm cards in Mistwood replace the basic Farms in your Everdell game. These often give you the choice of two abilities, and you choose which of these abilities to use each time the card activates.

More Legends
Legendary cards represent unique Critters and Constructions that are powerful upgrades of other Critters and Constructions. Use them when you are familiar with the base game, and are looking forward to a twist on a regular game! The More Legends cards in Mistwood are added into a game of Everdell in the same manner as the Legends from Everdell: Collector's Edition.
New ideas are arriving every day!
Station Cards
Faceup Critter and Construction cards on the Station board work like Meadow cards and may be played on your turn, but whenever you play a card from the Station, also gain the reward listed on the Train Car tile beside the card! This reward is gained after you have fully resolved the played card and any additional cards that may have activated as a result. After you've gained the reward, replenish both the Train Car tile and the card played.
Remember: cards on the Station board are not Meadow cards, and therefore any abilities that affect Meadow cards (such as the Inn) do not apply to Station cards!

Visitors
Newleaf is a bustling and growing city in Everdell, and now that the railway system is in full operation, many new critters and big ideas are coming into the Emerald Valley. The Visitor cards that come into play on the Station Board offer players a new end game scoring opportunity!
To gain a Visitor card on your turn:
Place a worker on the Station. The Station is a shared location, allowing several workers at once, but you may only have 1 of your workers on this location at a time.
Choose 1 of the faceup Visitor cards and discard it facedown on the Visitor discard pile.
Reveal 1 new Visitor card and choose 1 of the 2 faceup Visitor cards to take and place by your city. If you do not want either of the faceup Visitors, you may draw 1 from the top of the Visitor deck instead. If you selected one of the faceup Visitors, replace its card with another one from the Visitor deck.
Gain the reward shown on 1 of the Train Car tiles by the Station; set that tile aside and draw a replacement tile.
Visitor cards will score their listed point values, if your city contains their requirements at the end of the game. Visitor cards that you have obtained and failed to please (by not meeting their requirements) are not worth any points at the end of the game.

The Knoll
You may place a worker on the Knoll to choose any 3 cards from the Meadow and/or the Station to discard. Replenish the discarded cards from the main deck, and draw any 3 cards into your hand from the Meadow and/or the Station. After drawing your cards, you may then gain the reward shown on 1 of the Train Car tiles. Set that Train Car tile aside and draw a replacement tile from the bag. Finally, replenish the 3 cards you drew into your hand.
The Knoll is a shared location, allowing several workers at once, but you may only have 1 of your workers on this location at a time.
Everdell has a brand new villainess!
Now while playing Everdell, you can pit your wits against Nightweave, our newest automated player for solitaire and two-player games. Nightweave is designed to function like a real player at your table: she has her own hand of cards, Prepares for Seasons on her own schedule, and, most importantly, she has her own agenda!

Nightweave has her own Big Critter meeple along with 8 spider meeples (not just 6!) that will move about the board to do her bidding -- blocking exclusive Locations, taking events away before you can get them, and even enacting Plots and Plans that will interfere with your options as a player, reminiscent of the Weather cards from Spirecrest.  She has eight different personalities that influence what she targets and focuses on, so there's lots of variety in gameplay!

What Happens on Nightweave's Turn?
Turn over the top card of Nightweave's Activity deck. These cards are the heart of her decision-making during the game, instructing her to play cards into her city, place spider meeples on previous, exclusive Locations, take a Basic or Special event, etc.
Nightweave will perform the first action listed for her current season, if possible. If she cannot perform this action for any reason, she will take the second action for her current season. If she cannot take that action either, she will perform as much of the Default action at the bottom of the card as she can. This could include discarding cards, collecting point tokens (yes, really!), and/or a number of other actions.
If Nightweave herself is in the Meadow and there are no spiderlings left in her lair when she draws an Activity card with a Spider or Nightweave icon, she will Prepare for Season. 
The game ends when you run out of actions and when Nightwave Prepares for Season at the end of Autumn.

Can you stop Nightweave from taking over Everdell? Check out the Rulebook for more in-depth information about this automated player!

campaign.story:
Frank Miller's iconic story Batman: The Dark Knight Returns comes to life in a single-player strategy board game experience crafted by acclaimed game designers Morgan Dontanville (Asgard’s Chosen) and Daryl Andrews (Sagrada). Your skills will be tested across four scenarios, or Books, that each feature unique rules, allies, abilities, and epic boss battles! You'll have a limited amount of resources and turns to complete each of these four Books, and if Batman's Grit, Sanity, or Health ever drops to zero, it's game over…
Beyond staying alive in the short term, the world's greatest detective also has to plan for the long term: The "Doomsday Clock" persists across all four Books, as does the constantly evolving and always chaotic Gotham City. If the Doomsday Clock ever strikes midnight or Gotham becomes too overrun with Riots, it’s all over (hang up your cape and cowl... or try again!).
Each Book lasts four rounds and, in that time, you'll have to acquire enough Clues to track down the Boss's location, and then dispense justice by defeating them in order to progress to the next Book.
Gameplay each round is split into two halves. In the first half, you strategically pick your favorite Fight and Detective cards, which grant you unique abilities to prepare for future battles and for navigating Gotham. But think twice, because each of the cards you don't select has a unique Event that becomes part of the Event deck, which triggers each turn to keep you on your toes! In the second half of each round, Batman and his allies (such as Robin) will take to the streets of Gotham. Combine Ally Actions with Batman for some awesome combos!
After each round, you'll be able to DRAW directly on the board to create a new pathway between locations in Gotham. Make your way towards locations with possible leads; you may hit dead ends, DESTROY locations, or find Clues. Find enough Clues, and you'll learn the location of the Boss. Take down the Boss in order to complete the Book!
With a variable setup and a nearly endless combination of Fight, Detective, and Event cards, each playthrough of Batman: The Dark Knight Returns - The Game will throw a unique combination of resources and challenges at you!
           
 
For the uninitiated, The Dark Knight Returns is likely the most beloved Batman story ever told. Writer/artist Frank Miller’s four-issue series from 1986 was a watershed moment in comics, as it brought a dark and cinematic feel to the medium. Every Batman story since then owes something to it.
Let’s set the scene: In Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Gotham City is controlled by a brutal street gang called the Mutants and, since it’s the 1980s, the US and USSR appear to be on a collision course for mutual nuclear destruction. Also, being a superhero is illegal and Superman is now an agent for the government. It’s pretty dystopian, to say the least.
As for Bruce Wayne, he is 55 years old, way past his prime. And he’s been retired for years, ever since the Joker murdered Jason Todd, the last Robin. Spurred by the Mutants’ crimes and a reminder about the murder of his parents, he returns to his crime-fighting ways, but with a new edge. This time, he’s not holding anything back, using every bit of his smarts and battered body to take on the Mutant Leader, old archenemies the Joker and Two-Face, and even Superman, his one-time good friend. With Carrie Kelley, the new Robin, at his side, the Dark Knight takes another stand for justice and the soul of the city (and world) that he has defended for so long.

DKR Fans,
We have been silent as of late and there’s a reason: Like The Dark Knight himself, our team has been completely focused on the mission at hand. Are we trying to save Gotham City from violence and corruption too? Well, no, but our goal is nearly as noble: We’re trying to make Batman: The Dark Knight Returns — The Game the best experience it can be.
Our team has been burning the midnight oil to make sure to hit our production deadlines. We’ve been working with our amazing designers— Morgan Dontanville and Daryl Andrews—and our talented editor to finalize all the gameplay details. Our in-house project managers and graphic designers have been putting their hearts into making sure everything looks and plays as well (if not better) than you expect.

Soon, you’ll receive an email from us with a special link to your BackerKit survey. In order to lock in the orders and get started on production, we'll need to set a deadline for everyone to provide their addresses and do any upgrades or add-ons to their order by. campaign.story:
Bucket of Bolts is a game of iconic spaceships and their infamous captains for one player.
She may not look like much kid, but she’s got it where it counts!
The Bebop. Serenity. The Millennium Falcon. 
You can’t have a good space story without an iconic spaceship. Of course, more often than not, the heroes of the story aren’t flying some shiny new cruiser. Those are for the wealthy, the elites—not our lovable scoundrels. No, they fly the bucket of bolts—the outworn, patched-up junker held together with hope, prayers and duct tape.
The eponymous 'bucket of bolts'
These ships weren’t always hunks of junk though—they have long and storied histories, and might even have been respectable vessels at some point. We only ever see a slice of that story though, a single captain and their motley crew. 
This game flips the perspective.  

The Game.
Bucket of Bolts is a hack of Artefact, my game from last year's ZineQuest. Instead of creating a magical item, this time you'll be telling the story of a single spaceship. You’ll create a brand new freighter, fresh off the manufacturing line, and explore its history through each of the people who captain it. Your ship will change as the decades pass - new names, new parts, fresh paint, fresh starts - until your story draws to a close.
You’ll choose your Captains, bringing them to life with names and details, and create stories of their time with your ship using prompts and tables. When you‘re ready to move on, you’ll choose a Fate for your ship. Maybe it’s traded away fairly, but more likely it’s stolen, captured or even wrecked. You might drift for a while as you wait for your next Captain, or the seat might still be warm when a new one takes over. Either way, the galaxy will change around you, and you’ll see it all from the view in the cockpit.
Like the original Artefact, it’s a great way to spend an hour or two; sketching, world-building and storytelling in your own company. It's also a fantastic way to generate really unique ships for tabletop games like Edge of the Empire, Traveller or Scum & Villainy, with rich backstories, fun details and tonnes of personality.

The Zine.
Format 
A little paper prototype of the zine opening.
I'll be using a new format for the physical rewards. Beak zines take an A3 sheet of paper and fold it into an 8-page A6 booklet. This process leaves one side of the paper blank, that people sometimes use to make a poster.
One of the things that's always bugged me about Artefact is how much flicking around the book you need to do as you play the game. I thought—why not use the blank side of a beak zine for all of the game's content; the tables, questions and prompts you’ll need during play. So that’s what I’m doing.
In Bucket of Bolts, you’ll be able to read through all the rules in the booklet and then unfold it into a complete reference for play. Pretty neat huh?
And here it is closing!
Paper
Extract comes in a range of lovely colours.
Of course, I'm still taking every opportunity to make this little zine a deluxe product. I'll be using one of my favourite paper stocks, G.F Smith Extract.
As well as having some seriously impressive environmental credentials (it's made from recycled coffee cups), it's also just a lovely paper that comes in some great colours. I’m partial to Mustard, as you can see in the prototype, but we’ll see when the print samples arrive.

Ink
Copies of ARTEFACT, outside on a sunny day.
As with my previous projects, I’ll be using Risograph to print the book. That means rich, vivid shades with the aesthetic of screen printing, but viable for large-scale print runs. It’s also one of the most sustainable ways to print, with soy-based inks & low energy machines. It’s going to be beautiful!

Illustration
Torben is very excellent at drawing spaceships.
Speaking of beautiful, I'm also commissioning Torben Bökemeyer again to do some awesome illustrations for the game. Spaceships are his bread & butter, and I think his sharp, detailed style is a really good fit for this game. You’ll have seen his key art at the top of the page, and he's already hard at work on the game's cover.

Collector’s Edition
I'm looking forward to an excuse to get wild with paper & ink combos...
I’m also offering a Collector’s Edition of the game, exclusive to the Kickstarter, packed with bonus printed matter like art prints, stickers and random tables.
It’s all paper stuff, but I think it’s gonna feel pretty special.
Any ’game content’ (such as random tables) will be available to all as a digital download.

Accessibility
Like Artefact and Orbital, the digital edition will also be fully-compatible with screen readers. A second version will also be provided to support a range of visual processing needs. Once again, Yubi will be handling the accessibility design of the digital files.

Community Copies
Every backer of Bucket of Bolts, physical or digital, will also be contributing one digital copy of the game to be available for free for those who need it. Thanks!

Stretch Goals
This is intentionally designed as a small project, but I've still got some cool things to announce if we break past our funding goal :)

Delivery.
Timelines
I’ve got a draft of the game written, and I’m happy that the core concept works as well for spaceships as it did for magical items (after making a few changes to the design). I’m hoping to get a playtest version out in a month or two, with the full digital version being delivered in late spring/early summer and the physical edition following soon after.

BackerKit
As with my previous projects, I’ll be using BackerKit to manage fulfilment. This time, though, I’m collecting shipping fees through Kickstarter so you shouldn’t need to add funds in BackerKit unless you’ve selected add-ons.

Orbital 
Orbital header art
My previous project, Orbital, is going to print imminently which means that the bulk of the work for that Kickstarter is done. I’m not shipping out the rewards myself, and the stretch goal content is coming along nicely. I’ll continue to actively manage the project, but barring any catastrophes it shouldn’t take up much headspace.

ARTEFACT: Reviews & Remarks.
I’m so happy with the way Artefact has been received. Here’s hoping I can recapture some of that magic for Bucket of Bolts.
If you’re a returning backer: hi, nice to see you again! I hope you also enjoyed Artefact :)
Print copies of Artefact
"It combines a little bit of writing and a little bit of drawing with a lot of storytelling to make a game that is one of the most relaxing and mindful experiences I have had this year." - Shut Up & Sit Down
"This is a great system agnostic supplement that could fit on any gamer’s shelf". — Pulp Culture Museum
"It was a wonderful game that once I started, I had a hard time putting down. I probably spent 8-9 hours on the game over the course of a quarantined weekend, and ended up with a story that pulled at my own heart-strings." — Play Every Role
There are also lots of lovely comments on the game's itch.io page.
~
Thanks for reading!

Risks and challenges
This is my third project now, so I'm getting pretty confident in successfully delivering rewards. I've intentionally pitched a smaller-scale project this time, to fit around my existing life commitments. I'm using familiar software, processes and people, so there shouldn't be any surprises.

We've also welcomed the arrival of a second child into our family. We've figured it out. I think barring any serious family issues, we'll be fine. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges
 
Although this is the first campaign for Glass Cannon Unplugged, we have been working in teams that fulfilled 7 campaigns (games done by Phalanx and This War Of Mine: The Board Game) and manufactured and distributed more than 20 titles. We do not expect delays in production, but unforeseen issues may arise during manufacturing and shipping. We estimate that in the worst-case scenario, the production might suffer delays of at most 30-60 days, and shipping & customs may add an extra 15-45 days. We are experienced with large production runs, and we are preparing back-up plans for each step of the project, from production to shipping and final delivery. We will be working with trusted partners for manufacturing and logistics, their names will be revealed upon campaign launch.
 
By backing this project you agree that our primary responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being undeliverable or lost in transit. We are unable to ship to PO Boxes. We allow a maximum of one delivery location per backer, regardless of the number of pledges/copies ordered.
 
Please note that geopolitical events not under our control, such as Brexit and the imposition of new tariffs on the access of goods to a country, may change the terms we offer to residents of such countries, even if we guarantee we will do our best to avoid such issues.
 
COVID-19 has been a challenge for us all, we observe the global situation and think ahead, to minimize risk we have decided to work with companies that have a stable position on the market and to the best of our knowledge will not endanger the production and fulfillment of this project.
 
Since the start of the pandemic, we have been working remotely and plan to do so until it is once again safe to meet in the workplace. Using project management tools and Tabletop Simulator we are able to not only run the tests locally how we would in a normal situation but engage internationally with interested testers, this has been very beneficial to the project.

If you apply for a refund after the end of the Kickstarter then we will be able to refund 85% of your pledge. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order.
Once we have started to pack your order, refunds won't be possible.
Refunds are reversed via Stripe to the credit card you used to pledge originally. This project is being funded in EUR and any refunds processed will also be in EUR.
 
If you do not accept the proposed terms, then please do not back this project; kindly wait for the retail release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Frostlanders,
Today’s update is sponsored by the letter U, like the word unexpected 😊, dad’s jokes aside this update is ahead of schedule by 2 weeks! It is mainly because we’d like to place the game’s manual in your hands as soon as possible. This is a crucial step in the grand scheme of things, and we didn’t want to wait for the regular, monthly update to do so.
The text of the manual is ready. It is not digitally prepared yet, nor is it after the final proofreading since it will happen once your – community proofreading happens 😊. We’d like to ask all of you who feel the need and possess the time and skill to do so to read through the text looking for potential language slips and mistakes but also to provide us feedback if the rules as written are clear, accessible and leave little to no room for doubts.

Hello Frostlanders,
We hope that the spring has melted the snow and ice where you live (hopefully not on the South Pole…) and that you take your time to appreciate the sunshine and the blossoming nature. May is particularly beautiful here in Poland with lush, green trees and people smiling more often as the country is slowly coming back to life after the worst waves of the pandemic. Kids are back at school (thus our efficiency is a bit higher 😉) and things are looking good, and we look to the future with a shy smile of optimism.

Hello Frostlanders!
Today’s update will feature the updated Tabletop Simulator module as well as revised rules – just as mentioned in our last communication. We do hope that the changes we introduced will be to your liking – we are extremely excited about it! Please give a big shout out to Adam and to our dev team (Rafał, Grzesiek, Bartek and Paweł) thanks to whom Frostpunk: The Board Game is an even better game than before! The most essential changes were described in the last update so if you missed it we highly recommend acquainting yourself with it (it’s not short but it is packed to the brim with important information!), oh and don’t forget to come back to this update once you’re done reading 😉.

Due to the number of answers and your feedback we’ve just added both add-ons to the pledge manager and you can now add them to your baskets if you will. Both add-ons are also available for the late pledgers.

DISCLAIMER: If you are not interested in the alternative wooden game components nor the big-hold-it all-box please ignore this update. Our regular update is coming and will be posted in the first half of April. The April update will feature a detailed development & production schedules and a lot “what’s new” information. If you are curious about the potential new addons please keep on reading :-) !

updates.update_userinfo: Snow is thawing, the Spring is coming!
updates.update_content:
Greetings and salutations dear Frostlanders!
We hope that wherever it is that you call home you too can feel the coming of the Spring. In Poland we had a rather oldschool Polish winter with snow and temperatures of – 10 Celsius at night so it caused some everyday life issues and a ton of fun for the kids 😊. Surrounded by frosty weather, covered in snow and unable to leave (pandemic restrictions) we kind of felt trapped, as if in some crater with walls frozen solid…

updates.update_userinfo: Hear me, hear me! Pledge Manager is Live! Pre-Order is Live!
updates.update_content:
Hello Frostlanders!
We’ve said our goodbyes to 2020, although for us it had one major positive memory - it saw the birth of Frostpunk: The Board Game and this year will be all about seeing it land safely on your tables and stay there for many months, if not years to come! We are doing everything we can to deliver a game you’ve dreamt of. Happy New Year!
The Pledge Manager

Hello Frostlanders!
We decided to publish this, second after the campaign update, a bit sooner mainly because we wanted to pass our wishes to all of you beautiful souls! To those of you who partake in the Christmas tradition we wish the merriest possible time with your loved ones and to those of you who have other beliefs or simply don’t have any we hope that the upcoming year brings only the most welcome changes and improves every aspect of your lives. We hope that no matter where you are in World these last days of 2020 will allow you to catch a breath and gain the strength needed to face what 2021 has in store for us ;-). With a new hope we all look to 2021 to bring us challenges that we can easily overcome together without any bad outcomes, so let’s hope that the Event card to be drawn on the 1st of January will be a good and easy one ;-). To wrap it up we wish you all the strength and determination to turn the upcoming year into a series of success and joyful memories!

Hello Frostlanders!
We hope you missed us a bit, cause sure as heck we missed y’all!
Preparing and managing a Kickstarter campaign, let me tell you, It’s like being on a roller coaster. First the slow build-up, then it goes live, excitement and adrenaline courses through your veins, and before you know it, it’s over. All those pent up emotions have to find an outlet and be refocused elsewhere: towards fulfillment. And let me tell you, we haven’t wasted any of those short autumn days.
Work Report

Rahdo's runthrough:
How to play / preview video from Man vs Meeple: 
Full game playthrough by Slickerdrips:
 Full game playthrough by Once Upon a Die:
"We've loved every play of Roll Camera! and we can't get enough of this game." --Board's Eye View review
"I like this game! Definitely one I'd bust out again and again...doesn't feel like every other coop game, it feels different." --Jason Smith, Board Game Mechanics review
"If you’re looking for a game that gives you a lot to do in order to make a movie, or you just enjoy dynamic cooperative games, I’d recommend Roll Camera!" --What's Eric Playing? review
"That was GREAT!" "Let's play again right now!" --Playtesters Berto & Maki, immediately after losing their first game
"My only complaint is that I want more of everything!" --Joe G, BGG prototype review 
 The above components are a rendering only - art and material are subject to change, so the final copy may differ slightly from what you see here!
1. Kickstarter-exclusive. I have no plans to sell Roll Camera! to distributors for wide retail release. Too complicated. I have a day job, you know! It's possible individual retailers will back this project, and we might sell off extra copies online or at conventions, but if you want to make *sure* you get a copy, you gotta back it here and now.
But more importantly, backing now is...
2. More fun! Join the crew, throw your hat in the ring, be a part of making this thing happen now. It's what Kickstarter is all about, right?
Not pictured: $10 "Cinema Owner" - Retailer Pledge Level
Or rather, YOU did it! You unlocked the Clapper Box that really clappy claps! $100k - unbelievable!!
Here's a video of me with the factory's sample clapper box (please note I accidentally left the sample rulebook inside as well, that's the papery thing sticking out): 
Click to cast your vote!
To unlock some of the more "quality of life" upgrades to the game, we're trying something a bit different: just like you do in Roll Camera: the Filmmaking Board Game, during this campaign we're going to "shoot a film" together!
You see, there are 20 Scene cards in the base game, each with a textless image. In the game, you arrange these images in the Editing Room, and at the end of the game, you use the story cues on the board to weave them into a coherent plot. The board game has 5 slots for these cards. We're going to take that idea to its logical conclusion and tell a full-length feature film story out of all 20 Scene cards! 
But we need your help to shoot this film!
So: each "shooting day" (we shoot Tuesday-Saturday and take Sunday and Monday off), I'll reveal 3 Scene cards (below) and a poll (here on BoardGameGeek). Each of the cards is tied to a different game upgrade or bonus. Your job is to vote on 1 of the 3 Scenes to shoot that day. The winning Scene will unlock that upgrade or bonus for all copies of the game!
(The two Scenes that are not chosen MAY come back around again later on! They're not necessarily gone forever...)  
Click to vote on the final scene!
 Got it? Then:
Click here to cast your vote for today's Scene!
The winning Scene is then placed in the next available slot in the Editing Room below, where you can track which bonuses have already been unlocked and what point in the story we're at:   
Click to enlarge
 So make sure the Scene you vote for isn't just the upgrade you want, but also makes narrative sense! There's no re-editing allowed - we're cutting this baby on the fly.
This will allow you to participate more in how the game is upgraded, and give us a clear idea of which kinds of upgrades you actually WANT in the game. (Please note that these upgrades are not 100% guaranteed to feature in the final game - they PROBABLY will, but I reserve the right to change my mind if I think the upgrade will result in a worse product somehow.)
Some Scene bonuses will unlock new Scenes, so there should always be 3 Scenes and 3 upgrades to choose from. Some Scenes might become available again later, others might disappear forever! So choose wisely.
After the campaign, you'll have the chance to act out the scenes we've collectively "shot" and upload your videos. We'll all vote on the winner, who will receive a limited, playable Award Winner Idea card with their game!
If you want any or all of the above items as well, simply add the $ amount to your pledge now, and you'll be given a credit for that amount in the pledge manager after the campaign, which you can redeem for those items. Shipping is FREE if you add these to your standard game pledge.
Itchy Feet: the Travel Card Game was my first ever game and Kickstarter, launched in 2017. You'll recognize it from the bean people artwork of course! This is the retail version, which differs slightly from the one printed on the Kickstarter - it has an additional couple cards, and the passport cards have been redesigned. 
The metal dice are the same size, color and have the custom faces for the game - they're playable game components. But metal!

(Note that if you pledge less than the $49 game and want the dice or Itchy Feet separately, you'll have to chip in a couple extra bucks later for shipping. Exact amount TBD.)

Hello! I'm Malachi Ray Rempen, and I designed, illustrated, and will publish Roll Camera! The Filmmaking Board Game. It ain't my first rodeo, though; in 2017 I Kickstarted my first game, Itchy Feet: the Travel Game, based on my long-running web comic of the same name. That game was meant to be a one-off thing, but game design is now quickly becoming my new obsession. I just love it! And that's why this year I started Keen Bean Studio. I think I might be doing a lot more of this kinda thing.
Filmmaking was always my greatest passion, however. I've been making movies since I was 10! I've made short films, long short films, commercials, documentaries, screened at festivals worldwide, won awards, and now I run a filmmaking degree course and teach others how to make movies. I've been a writer, a director, a producer, a cinematographer, an editor, a boom operator, an extra...I've done it all, sometimes all at the same time!
Roll Camera! was made so I could share with you that unique, raw mix of agony, euphoria, stress, joy, puzzle-solving, teamwork, pressure, and creativity that is so addictive about making movies. It's not easy, but man - it's fun. 
I think you'll enjoy it!
Like any proper movie director, I am surrounded by people who make me seem more talented than I actually am. This production has only been made possible thanks to their patience, generosity, and support. I'd like you to read their names, because they're real humans and they are awesome!
Iris & Noah - my wife and son, not just patient but honest. Thanks for knowing when to pull me away from my work! Erik Rempen, thanks for always being willing to play yet ANOTHER prototype and having great ideas (and good luck with your game too!), and Kilian Rempen, thank you for packing and shipping those prototypes! Chris Palmer, thanks for your endless support and enthusiasm, and also for donating your formidable spreadsheeting skills. Oliver Valente, thank you for the encouragement and kindness wrapped in delightful snark. Maxime Rioux, thanks as always for being available to bang heads together, and for lending me your designer's eye for detail. Jayden Bailey and Agostina Cerdan, thank you for organizing the countless hours of testing and for just being up for anything. Max Sacker, thanks so much for all the awesome movie stuff for the video. Tony Go, thank you for giving me your blessing to use your ingenious crew dice mechanic from Deep Space D-6! Very special thanks to my parents for always encouraging both hard work and play. And thank you from the bottom of my heart to everyone else who provided their time, thoughts, and support. It really meant a lot to me.
Credits
Roll Camera! is designed & illustrated by Malachi Ray Rempen. Rulebook by Sam Hillier. Graphic design consultation by We Are Knytt. Print-and-play by Martin Gonzalvez. Lead blind playtesters were Maxime Rioux, Jayden Bailey, Michael Herbers, Dan Callaghan, Grattan Aikins and Isabelle Schmitz. Video lit, shot and VO'd by Oliver Valente; written, directed, edited and sound designed by Malachi Ray Rempen. Video cast/crew: Jayden Bailey, Agostina Cerdan, Kamilija Cizaite and Zac Yeates.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't my first game or Kickstarter campaign - but it is my first full-on board game, my first time manufacturing in China, and my first time doing all this (largely) by myself. So there are plenty of risks: any number of global catastrophes could of course delay production and shipping, but also I might make a misstep or miscalculation along the way. I'm only human after all! Keep in mind that everything you see in terms of artwork and design is subject to change before we deliver, and that most of the numbers and times posted here are estimates. Educated estimates, but estimates nonetheless. Also, I reserve the right to change my mind about any of the voted upgrades if I feel their inclusion will negatively impact the final product.

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that these changes might occur and that the final project could differ from what is presented on this page.

But if there's one thing I take extremely seriously, it's getting you and all other backers your rewards while meeting or exceeding expectations. I mean that. From the beginning of this project, that's been the destination for me. That's why when I run into an area I'm less familiar with, I do everything in my power to learn as much as I can and consult with as many experts as possible to catch up. I also listen carefully to your suggestions and feedback for the same reason.

This is also why I've studied other Kickstarters and tried to limit the number of complicating factors I've seen impact delivery elsewhere. The game has been extensively playtested, including the upgrades, and I'm not adding loads of content that will require additional testing and cause delays. So design and development are pretty much there. The artwork is 95% done, and I'm doing it myself so I don't need to wait on someone else. I'm not adding fancy components or multiple versions that will stall things - I've already confirmed most of the components with the manufacturer. 

And as a filmmaker, I'm a big fan of planning ample buffer time and budget, because inevitably things will go wrong. What I do is assume they will go wrong and plan accordingly. And I pledge to be transparent with you, and communicate clearly and often all along the way. Just look at my last campaign (Itchy Feet: the Travel Game) to get an idea of how I like to operate.

PLEDGE MANAGER: after the campaign we'll be using a third-party pledge manager. Here you'll be able to change your address after the campaign ends and order additional copies of the game if you wish. But you MUST fill out all the required information! If you don't complete the pledge manager by the deadline, you may lose your reward! Last time I had backers contacting me *literally years* after the project had shipped. You will have plenty of time to fill it out before the deadline and you will receive several reminders along the way. PLEASE check your email after the campaign and ensure our messages are not going to spam.

And if you have any concerns, ideas, help, or questions, please get in touch!

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
I hate waste. That's why I always look for the strongest, highest-quality materials - it may not make it the cheapest product, but it will hopefully ensure staying in your home and out of the landfill as long as possible.

Although shrink wrap may seem like a perfect example of damaging single-use plastic, it actually protects the games and components (which are mostly paper, remember) from mold, moisture, and temperature changes during the shipping and fulfillment process. Without it, the waste created would be immense. So until there's a good alternative to plastic wrap, it's actually doing the environment a big favor here.
Reusability and recyclability
One great thing about board games is that they are almost infinitely reusable. Even if you get tired of Roll Camera!, the board game second hand market is a rich and vibrant place. These days, you can always find a good home for a board game. 

NEVER throw out a board game! Even if something gets damaged or a key piece gets lost, contact us and we will try to send you a replacement part. This again helps maintain the lifespan of the game for as long as possible.
Sustainable materials
Plastic is a menace to our environment, which is why whenever possible, I want to avoid plastic in favor of cardboard - for example, with the box insert. The only fully plastic game components are the budget/schedule clips (I have not yet been able to find a durable non-plastic alternative) and the dice, which will be acrylic. 

For a long time I went back and forth on wood or plastic dice. I decided that plastic dice are longer lasting and more resistant to damage than wood. Also because they are a critical game component, are much less likely to be lost or destroyed.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although every project comes with risks, we've done our best to minimize them. This isn't our first project and we're partnering up with a few other experienced companies. However, we rely on our suppliers just as you rely on us, and hope for a relationship of mutual understanding.

We've worked with different manufacturers in the past and don't work any more with those not living up to our expectations. That's why we choose a new manufacturing partner that has done games for major publishers and creators and who has come recommended with impeccable credentials. 
Some events may be out of our reach. One such event is COVID-19. To take such events into account we've talked with the manufacturer and gave ourselves some more time to deliver the game. We would love to tell you your game will arrive earlier, instead of the other way around...

Shipping is always a risk, especially when shipping international orders. After production is complete, we'll be shipping the game worldwide through several fulfillment centers, ensuring that we have "Friendly Shipping" (no import taxes) to the US, EU, Canada, Australia and New Zealand. We'll also be subsidizing a portion of the shipping cost for all pledges to keep your costs down. Like before, we're using a highly renowned fulfillment partner for an ultra smooth fulfillment process. For more information see terms & conditions above.

The EU has recently implemented stricter tax regulations on online sales in general and crowdfunding in particular. We thus are obliged to collect and pay VAT on the value of the total of the pledge and shipping amount. VAT varies between 17% and 25% with most countries at 20% and above. The total amount is calculated on the amount paid for the game and the shipping. We have taken these costs into account so you will not need to worry about them. It is important to note that VAT is a sales tax that is separate from import taxes or duties. We will cover import duties in the USA, Europe, Canada, Australia and New Zealand so you do not have to worry about those. Other regions might incur import duties.

Adventures in Neverland has been developed over 5 years, with numerous play-testers and groups in different countries. A new batch of test groups will be brought in after the end of the Kickstarter (and COVID-19) to test the final content and to blind test the rulebook.
 
Lastly, although we are working very hard to expand our range of games, we put originality before anything else. Every game we publish must be an original masterpiece, drooling with flavor by itself. We will do everything in our power to achieve this goal. Like our previous games, we will listen to the backers. Together Adventures in Neverland will be a unique game, dedicated to J.M. Barrie's legacy!

We heard your feedback and we went back to the drawing board. Townbuilder Unlimited is what we came up with.
The Townbuilder is a web application with which you can create custom 3D printable buildings for Tabletop Games. We provide detailed 3D models in the form of small building blocks that you can then use to create the perfect building for your table. All of our buildings can be printed support free and feature playable interior.
You can either start from scratch or modify one of our many prepared templates to fit your needs.
PLAY

When you back this campaign, you will get unlimited access to the Townbuilder, meaning you can build, download and print as many buildings as you want... forever. Depending on the reward tier you back at, you will gain access to different themes, which will be available to you in the Townbuilder.

We are working with  2nd Dynasty to bring SciFi into the Townbuilder! These tiles ARE NOT PART OF THE CAMPAIGN PLEDGES and will cost you 15€ as an addon. For a lot more info check our update on this.
We have partnered up with the awesome folk from Arcane Minis who just ran the Skies of Sordane campaign.
Through this collab every backer that gets access to Premium Set II: Steampunk will get Steampunk themed airports added to their pledge for FREE. These will be modular as everything in the Townbuilder, allowing you to go for any width and lenght.
Benny and his team at Arcane Minis will also create interchangeable stands that will allow the ships to dock to our buildings, raising and lowering them to fit with our 50mm height system!
Their Kickstarter special prices and exclusive Arcane Dragon Mini are only available until May 1st, so head on over and show them some love from us!
CHECK OUT THE SKIES OF SORDANE LATE PLEDGES HERE
The usefulness of our tool relies upon a large selection of themes to choose from. There are only so many classical medieval buildings one can print before being fed up.
That is why our main focus for the future is expanding our themes. As a proof of concept that the Townbuilder has potential, we chose very classical themes. These are represented by our "Basic Sets", which are included in every pledge level and also in the free version of the Townbuilder.
The Basic Themes include Stone, Fachwerk, some Miscellaneous Items, and corresponding Medieval Roofs.
Check out our showcases below but note that they do not display all models individually as this would simply take up to much time and work.
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY





The Premium Sets will be the two choices of the community and will be modeled as soon as the Kickstarter closes. If you are a backer, you can find the link to the poll in their respective update posts or on the top of the Kickstarter campaign.
We don't have any 3D models to show so far since they will be modeled after... well we know what they will be.
Premium Set I has officially been decided: It will be Sewers and Caves, for which we have some concept art below.
Premium Set II has also been decided: It will be Steampunk, check it out below!







Townbuilder Basic
The Basic is free for everyone. As soon as you sign up for a free account after the Kickstarter you can try out the Townbuilder and even testprint some buildings. Obviously we want to encourage buying the Townbuilder, therefore the functionality of the Basic version is... well pretty basic.
Townbuilder Unlimited
The Unlimited Version has everything you need to build hundreds of custom houses. Every functionality we think makes using the Townbuilder easier will be included here.
Townbuilder Infinite
The Infinite Version adds nothing you need... but a lot of things you want. Want a 20 story high wizard tower? If your PC can handle it, knock yourself out. Want to create nice rendered pictures of your building while exploring them in first person perspective, seeing through the eyes of a miniature, here you go!  Want to create a custom sign for each guild of your world, with their custom logo and name... guess what? Townbuilder Infinite is for you.




Apprentice
The "Apprentice Townbuilder" includes the Townbuilder "Unlimited" Edition and all Basic sets. This tier allows you to create an endless number of buildings in the classical medieval fantasy style. Perfect for people that want to get started in the hobby or that just want to test out the tool for a low price.
Journeyman
The "Journeyman Townbuilder" also includes the Townbuilder "Unlimited" Edition but a lot more models. Two additional sets are included here, which will be based on community decision so you can influence what you get. And then all Stretchgoals that will be unlocked are also included here. So if the Kickstarter takes off, you will get a lot of different models for your money, enabling you to build all kinds of different buildings.
Master
The "Master Townbuilder" includes the Townbuilder "Infinite". In this premium Townbuilder Version, you will find loads of cool features that let you enhance your gameplay. These range from a rendering studio that allows you to walk around in and outside your building and take screenshots of it, to a custom logo and text tool, which will allow you to upload your own custom logos and add them to banners and signs inside the Townbuilder. We have a lot of plans for these cool gadgety features and we already started working on some of them as the development of all basic features comes to a close.
Guild Head
The "Smith's guild head" includes everything listed above for the Master Townbuilder and one additional feature: You get to decide two 100% custom models that we will sculpt for you and add to the Townbuilder. This can be anything you want, from a vegetable garden for your farm village to the symbol of your game's largest Kingdom as a banner to be affixed to your buildings. This allows for a whole new level of customization. Just an idea though, choose something that you want to use a lot, something that we don't feature yet and that will be a common feature for your buildings. 
Syndicate Leader
The "Smith's syndicate leader" includes everything listed above for the Master Townbuilder and one teeny tiny additional feature... You are playing a Steampunk game but the community didn't vote for the steampunk stretchgoal? Boy, do I have something for you.
YOU GET TO COMMISSION A SET !!!!
Yes you can trust your eyes, this is an actual tier we offer. We will create a custom set for you and do our best to make it as close to your wishes as possible while still having it fit with our system.





If we reach the 1000€ that are necessary to keep the servers running for the coming years, the real fun begins. If you are unfamiliar with the way stretch goals work, here is a quick introduction: Whenever the campaign's funding reaches a certain threshold a stretch goal is unlocked. If we raise enough money to keep the office running for a full month, we can release an additional set at no cost, that's the basic idea.
Each stretch goal unlocked means you get more bang for your buck and we get to do what we love as a job, win-win!








We have partnered with the awesome folks of OTP Miniatures and Scenery to offer you guys the option to get your buildings printed!
Though we don't offer printed Kickstarter tiers this time around, every backer of the Kickstarter will receive 10% off their first order for a building created in the Townbuilder at OTP's shop. This way you get your print at the same discount as if it was bought during the Kickstarter.
After the Kickstarter we will also offer seller licenses. If you own a print shop or offer a printing service, feel free to reach out to us via info@townsmith.de .




We are a small company from Saarland, Germany. Our team consists of (currently four) tabletop enthusiasts, who love nerdy shit and who enhance tabletop games with 3D printing! Tom, Christopher, and Monika are computer scientists and Leevke is our intermedia designer.
Christopher "Korson" Adam - PM, CEO, 3D Dev, 3D printing Enthusiast, DM
"Greetings! I'm the guy, who brought 3D printing to Townsmith. I've been playing tabletop games, namely Dungeons and Dragons, for just about 4 years now. I found out very early that being the game master was perfect for me and I've GMd ever since.
I soon developed a need for something more than just a piece of paper when designing my encounters. Equipped with a cheap Anet A8, I began to delve deep into 3D printing for tabletop games. From then on, my arsenal of both models and printers started growing until I got frustrated with the limited customization options for the terrain that is out there.
For Townsmith, I take on the role of the project manager, 3D programmer, and CEO. If anything weird happens in the Townbuilder, yeah that's most likely my fault."
Tom "Zatho" Zahlbach, CTO, Webdeveloper - Fullstack, DM, Player, Documentation Enthusiast
"Hey, I'm Tom. I'm the guy that had to read around 300 pages of Amazon Web Services documentation to get this project hosted for all of you. So yeah, I am somewhat of a masochist ... but, I also got to code a bunch which, if anything in this world, I adore. Everything website-related and invisible to you, as well as all the things behind the website, are written mostly by me. Additionally, I also take care of our AWS infrastructure. In my free time, I play D&D 5e with my friends both as a player and as a DM
For Townsmith I take on the role of CTO. Which... well, says not much since I get to help with everything that needs to be worked on."
Monika "Her Smolness" Unruh - Lead 3D Artist, Dice Enthusiast, Player
"Hey I'm Monika, I'm a Scorpio and 1,62 m tall, whatever you want to do with that information. I've known Tom and Christopher since school and started playing DnD with them in 2017, which made me become a dice-hoarder. When the two of them came up with the idea of Townsmith I was really hyped about it. Half-jokingly I asked them if they needed someone to help with the 3D modeling since I'm somewhat of an artistic person and was interested in trying digital art and 3D modeling.
To my surprise, they said yes and so I came on board and am now a 3D modeler for Townsmith, but I'm still learning, so if the models start floating randomly that's probably on me."
Oliver "Ore" Inglen - Master of the positive aura
"Hello, my name is Oliver. I am new to the world of tabletops, dungeons and dragons, but have been working in 3D and modeling for many years. Actually, I was working in the field of architectural modeling and visualizations until a mutual friend brought me to Christopher. Since then I have been working on my sculpturing techniques for modeling your feature blocks and will also do some concept art! I am really happy to be able to support the Townsmith team while doing fun work. If you have any suggestions for details, get in touch with me. Can´t wait to model all this!"
Leevke "Insomnyu" Reher - Concept Artist, Supporting 3D Artist, Meme Enthusiast
"Ahoy! I'm Leev! My full name is Leevke Fee Thordis Reher but that's kinda overkill, so call me Leev. I've been playing lots of Pen&Paper in my early childhood but couldn't seem to find a fitting group when I got older. But in 2018, I was introduced to Christopher and his great dedication to Dungeons and Dragons. Since I'm currently studying InterMedia Design, the opportunity to do my internship at Townsmith presented itself.
I joined shortly before the Kickstarter launched, so until now I did some of the concept art. Later I'll dive into some of the 3D Modeling and digital design for the community voted themes. So if there's anything wrong, blame the others, I'm innocent."
If you have any questions about us or what we do, feel free to join our Discord Server and get in touch with us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As you can clearly see, we are a very young team.
This is our first project though not our first Kickstarter campaign. A few months ago we already launched a Kickstarter with a different business model. We have learned a lot since then and we also improved the Townbuilder.

Still, we are inexperienced by industry standards (Printable Scenery, Heroforge, Fat Dragon Games, etc.). Though we do our best to be responsive and professional, but our lack of experience will be visible when it comes to some aspects.
Will the site be up 100% of the time? I doubt it.
Will we fix it as soon as it goes down? Yes, we will.
Will the range of themes increase as fast as heroforge's does? Well, it depends. It took us about three months to get the current models going, but we have gotten a lot faster at it and we will have more time to invest into modeling since there will be less programming work to do.

Most importantly: The Townbuilder is basically ready for release weeks before the launch of the Kickstarter and we only need to polish up a few things, including the UX. There is little risk that you will not be able to create and download buildings after the Kickstarter closes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After three years, Cephalofair Games is back and better than ever. Isaac ran all previous Kickstarters by himself, but now Cephalofair Games has a team, and that team is ready to make sure everything goes according to plan.

We've still got a long road ahead to fully finish the game. Our plan is to get the files to the printer in October, which should give us plenty of time to print everything and get your games shipped to you by early next year. No doubt there will be complications along the way — there always are — but we feel well-equipped to handle them. We have great confidence in our manufacturer, freight shippers, and fulfillment centers to get the job done right.

Of course, we would be remiss if we didn't talk about that elephant over there — COVID-19. This pandemic could have effects on every leg of our journey, from manufacturing to freight shipping to fulfillment. Luckily, it won't have much of an effect on the development of the game, and we won't be moving onto those other steps until the fall. Hopefully the situation will be better by then, but either way, we will be constantly communicating through updates to let you know if there are any changes to the plan.
