campaign.story:
Set in the West Indies, The Pirate Republic is a strategic, immersive combat exploration game for 1–5 pirates. Players choose from a number of historical pirates and explore dangerous locations full of royal navies, heavily defended forts, treasure fleets, and pirate hunters. 
Taking place during the sunrise of the Golden Age of Piracy, the game introduces a number of innovative mechanics that let you play a fully cooperative or fully competitive adventure. 
Through daring feats and plunder on the high seas, gameplay remains faithful to this rich time period of revolt and revolution from which the legendary Golden Age pirates continue to live on in our movies, TV shows, and popular culture. 
Are you ready to add to the legend of adventure and swashbuckling glory?
It's time to embrace that inner pirate...in all of us.
  The Pirate Republic is much more than a classic hack-and-slash game. Like the best medium complexity games, this one requires strategic thinking, clever planning, a little bit of luck, and exemplary teamwork to succeed.
We don’t like complicated Kickstarters, so we’ve made this one as simple as possible. There are just four pledge levels for you pirates: Basic Edition, Collector's Elite, Art Connoisseur, and Legend.
  Each card remains true to the time period from Pirate’s initial deck, to Elite Pirate, Crew, and Treasure cards. All card image art was created with pens, paints, and pencils to reflect an authenticity unique to today's digital age.
       Who other than the most successful pirate of the Golden Age: Bartholomew "Black Bart" Roberts and his forty-gun frigate, The Royal Fortune. This painting includes a collection of combat scenes true to the period.
  With works in galleries across the world, Chris Collingwood paints solely with traditional Dutch oil paints, manufactured now as they were in 1664. Click on the image to see more.
         We realize some of you pirates out there like to show off your swagger—we've got you covered.
As an add-on for $17, we also have a custom dice tray. Or, you can spend your doubloons for $25, and get 11 steel miniatures. The miniatures replace the Pirate Hunter and Treasure Fleet tokens in the game. Combine the two add-ons for an even sweeter deal of $31 (totaling $11 dollars off in combined savings).
Or, you can throw us $30 coin for a neoprene game play mat. Combine the entire lot (dice tray + miniatures + play mat) for the sweetest deal of $51 (totaling $21 dollars off in combined savings!).
To add these little beauties to your pledge, add $17 (dice tray); $25 (steel miniatures); $31 (dice tray + miniatures); $30 (neoprene play mat); or, $51 (for all of 'em) per game order. 
To keep shipping costs low, pirates can add 1 to each game order for up to 2 games. Manually enter the $ total when making your pledge or click the blue "Manage" button next to a previously made pledge.
All pledges must be made in full by March 29th. We don't use a pledge manager—backers may NOT increase their pledge or add on more items at the KS prices after the campaign ends.
What's better than pirates? More pirates. 
Your shipment will include every stretch goal unlocked during the campaign, regardless of your reward level! 
So the more people who support the project, the more goals get unlocked. With your help, we can squeeze over 30% more value into that metaphorical cannon bore, and fire off a more fully stuffed game to you! 
  Click Here For Facebook "Likes & Sharing."
                                                            With the game's modular gameplay, you get to decide if tonight will be competitive or cooperative.  Don't worry, you saboteurs, there is room on the ship for you too.  
Next, with no fixed scenario, it’s as simple as drawing cards, choosing the direction to explore, rolling the sailing die, and flipping tokens on the game board to fight.
Each time you decide where to go, you'll experience new danger as you carry out secret missions, squash mutinies, or maybe have a go at the treasure fleet, teasing you with her sweet riches. Each location becomes a real risk to your hard-won progress. 
So do you return to your pirate haven to rest and spend part of a turn strengthening up? Or do you throw caution to the wind and press on, praying that the next enemy won't be beyond your capabilities? 
After all, you are a pirate and no one tells you what to do... 
Combat is both fast and deadly in The Pirate Republic.
The game rewards clever players and punishes sea-rovers trying to go somewhere fast without any sense of direction or pursue "all sail, no wind" strategies. Players must time their encounters in order to fight more effectively and strengthen their pirate.
    More Game Reviews:  Undead Viking, Forensic Gameology, & Tantrum House.
We will pre-pack The Pirate Republic in a robust mailer box at the factory, and use quality fulfillment companies in each region to keep customs fees, VAT, and shipping costs as low as possible so you can back more games! All pledge levels include USD $15 for shipping, freight, and customs, though backers in some regions will need to pay additional fees, as follows:
Backers are limited to two games per pledge (a mix of any two versions of the game is fine; only pay the shipping fee once per pledge, not once per game).
To add more games beyond the first, or to buy add-ons, manually enter the money total when making your pledge or click the blue "Manage" button next to your existing pledge.
Check out the rules for The Pirate Republic to see how it blends inspirations from Dungeons and Dragons™ (critical hits and misses), Mage Knight® (card combat), Dead of Winter® (chaotic events), and Shadows Over Camelot® (sabotage). 
Once this campaign funds, we will bring on professional game editor Joshua Yearsley—whose work includes Vast: The Crystal Caverns and Lagoon: Land of the Druids—to revamp the rulebook and cards, ensuring they read as well as the game plays.
  We will support game stores around the world by offering Kickstarter versions of the game to retailers during the campaign. We package 5 games into 1 carton, carton size: ~401x400x274mm, Gross weight per carton, ~14-18KG depending on reward tier.
If you're a retailer, please contact Tom at greenfeetgames@gmail.com during the campaign for pricing information. After the campaign, you can reserve retail copies of The Pirate Republic by contacting our distribution broker.
                                                                                                                                                                       Lastly...why you, why this game, why now?  Click here to learn more.

This is not our first voyage, and we've done well to limit any fog and friction keeping us from setting sail. We are fully aware of potential delays that may happen with products that are produced in China—the common ones being production, shipping, Mother Nature, and customs delays.

Fair winds and following seas is the goal this time. This way we can complete production by May and get the games to you in August or September.

We've printed a preproduction run of ten copies to ensure the manufacturing quality of the game. People who have played and playtested these copies were over the moon with our component quality.

campaign.story:
Welcome to DVG's 
Sherman Leader Kickstarter!
NEW STRETCH GOALS!
New Add-Ons!
Many people have asked for Neoprene roll-up Tactical Displays for our games. We have finally been able to source huge high quality mats at a reasonable price!
        When the Kickstarter ends, we'll email everyone a survey. When you fill-out that survey with your mailing address and such, you will also add the game you'd like for free if you pledged for Sherman Leader or higher.
We can do this! Tell your friends and gaming group about this amazing game and offer! Let's make this happen!
        In Sherman Leader, you command an American group of tanks, armored cars, trucks, half tracks, and infantry squads. You get to choose your campaign. Anything from 1942 North Africa to 1945 Berlin, and everything in between. Of course we have the D-Day and Italian Campaigns!
Sherman Leader is a great game for both experienced strategy gamers and well as new players. Each campaign takes only 30 minutes to set-up, and each battle can be resolved in 15 to 30 minutes.  
Being a solitaire game, you can play whenever you have time, at your pace. This is very important. Sherman Leader is not a multiplayer game that has solo play rules tacked on. It was designed from the ground up to be a 1 player game.  
Sherman Leader is the latest game in our "Leader" series. Previous games: Hornet Leader, Phantom Leader, Thunderbolt-Apache Leader, and U-Boat Leader. As a side note, you can divide up your forces and play co-op with a friend. Let's talk a little about how the game plays.
Not only do you get to select a Campaign, you also get to choose your Campaign's Objective. Do you want to conduct an Assault? a Holding Action, a General Offensive? Each Objective lists your resources and goals.
Mixing and matching Campaigns and Objectives gives the game endless variety and replayability.
You then get to select your units and commanders.  
Sherman includes dozens of American vehicles and infantry types from the early Lee's and Grant's all the way up to the late war Jumbo Shermans!
Having great equipment is important, but having skilled commanders is vital. Here are 3 of the 6 stages of experience for Commander Smith...
Commanders have 6 skill levels: Recruit, Green, Average, Skilled, Veteran, and Ace. They gain Experience Points when you commit them to battle, but they also suffer Stress. As they gain experience, they advance to higher skill levels and improve their stats. As they suffer Stress, their abilities decline. This means you must carefully decide when to assign your men to battle, and when to let them rest.  
You will be fighting against the German Army!
Here is what your battlefield looks like...
You can play battles in the rural terrain of Europe, the sands of North Africa, and the freezing cold of winter!
Each Campaign is divided into Weekly turns. During each Week, you get to assign your tanks and commanders to battles, and then resolve those battles. At the end of each Week, the German forces advance, hold, or retreat in relation to your front line. This gives you the big picture and battlefield action all in one game.
Let's talk about what the battlefield combat is like...  
Each battle usually lasts 5 turns. During each turn, you roll to see the German units' overall movement strategy, your Fast Commanders get to act, then the German units get to act, and then your Slow Commanders get to act.  
Each unit moves and then attacks. Units have a speed of 0 (a Field Gun), 1 (Tanks), or 2 (Armored Cars). Units have an Attack range of 0 to 3 hexes.  
You move a unit, and if it is within range of an enemy unit, it gets to attack.  
To perform an attack, roll 2 10-sided dice.
To successfully attack, you need to roll the attacking unit's Attack number or higher on a die. If each successful die roll inflicts a potential Hit.
Subtract 1 from your rolls if attacking at Range 2, and subtract 2 if attacking at Range 3.   
For example: Your Sherman M4 (76mm) needs to roll a 5 or higher on each 10-sided die to score a potential Hit against a Panzer III. The Tank Commander gives +1 on Attack rolls. You need to roll 4s or higher.
For each potential Hit you score, roll a Defense die for the target. If you roll their Defense value or lower, the Hit is negated.
For example: You roll a 6 and 8 to Attack. Both will Hit unless stopped by the Panzer's Defense. You roll a 1 and 4 for the Defenses. One Hit is stopped, but the other penetrates, and Destroys the Panzer. 
Combat works the same when they shoot at you.  
Instead of destroying your Units, they inflict 1 Damage counter for each successful Attack roll that your Defense does not stop.  
Here are a few of the Damage counters. There is a different set of counters when your Vehicle or Infantry Units suffer Damage.
These Damage counters have an immediate effect on your Unit. They also stay with the Unit until you pay to repair them.
240 Full Color Cards  
2 Full Color Counter Sheets  
3 Full Color Sheets of MOUNTED Terrain Hexes  
22” x 17” Full Color MOUNTED Tactical Sheet  
11" x 17" Full Color Headquarters Sheet  
1 10-sided die 
Each Sherman game comes with a FREE Tiger Leader Upgrade Kit. This Kit includes all the cards, counters, and rules needed to upgrade Tiger Leader to the new Sherman standard.
Add-Ons!
You can add to your pledge! Once you pledge for the game, you can then manually adjust your pledge amount to any value. When we send out the Surveys, we'll add a question asking the items you Added. We'll ship them all in the same package. Your Add-Ons will not increase your shipping cost. We will cover the extra shipping charges.
      STRETCH GOALS!

Review by UndeadVikingVideos
    https://www.sparemin.com/myrecording/6093/
   A revolution of industry is in full swing. Everywhere you look, people and animal power are being replaced by steam-powered machines. Steam rises from every street corner, filling the city with noise and commotion. It is the industrial revolution at the height of Victorian England. A new technology called the link is on the rise and you want to profit from it. The link makes it possible to live in the sky. People are clamoring for the chance to visit or live high overhead. You decide to sink all you have into the venture. It is all or nothing. Empires of steam documents the rise of your empire as it grows on water, land and in the great expanse overhead.
  MANEUVER phase: In this phase, the player may play one population/maneuver card. Maneuver cards are cards labeled as population/maneuver at the bottom of the card. In this phase, only consider the maneuver portion of the card. Since players do not start the game with any maneuver cards in their initial deck of (5) cards, a player will not have any maneuvers to play during the first turn, but may be able to shortly after. Normally, a player may play only one maneuver card, but this number may be modified by playing other maneuver cards from their hand. To play a MANEUVER card, the player takes the maneuver card from his hand and lays it face-up in his play area. He announces which card he is playing and follows the instructions written on that card. The player may still play a maneuver card even if he is not able to do everything the maneuver card tells him to do/ but the player must do as much as he can. Also, the player must fully resolve the maneuver card before playing another one (if he is able to play another maneuver card). For example, if a card played gives +1 maneuver, the player uses his given maneuver to play that card. Then, because of the +1 maneuver, the player gets an additional maneuver. If the card gives +2 maneuvers, then the player has an additional 2 maneuvers remaining on that turn, etc. After accumulating more maneuvers and purchases, you can use these to place cards into your empire, attack another player (counts as a maneuver) until you have used all of your maneuvers for that turn.
PURCHASE phase: In the PURCHASE phase the player can gain a card from the supply by paying its cost. Any card in the SUPPLY may be PURCHASED (support, platforms, population/maneuver, people and coin cards). Players automatically get 1 PURCHASE per turn, but he may buy more if he played certain cards earlier in his MANEUVER phase that gave him additional PURCHASES. The cost of a card is in the lower right corner. The player may play some or all of the gold cards from his hand to his play area and add to their value the coins provided by MANEUVER cards played this turn. The player may then gain any card in the supply of equal or lesser value. He takes the purchased card from its SUPPLY pile and either places it face-down on his discard pile or placing it into his empire. He may not use the ability of the card when it is gained toward maneuvers or purchases on this turn. If you do not have enough coins to purchase a card, you can always get a (1) coin card valued at 0 coins.  
PLACE phase: This phase is where your empire grows. Placing cards means the card expands your empire, but will not go back to your discard pile. Cards used for maneuver and purchases cannot be placed in your empire on this turn. Placing cards into your empire will shrink your playing deck, but gains you population points which is the goal of the game. Many cards require other cards in order for them to be placed and count toward your population total. When you have completed all maneuvers, purchases and placings, put all cards into your discard pile. Then draw 5 new cards from your DRAW pile to prepare for your next turn Remember you can place up to 3 cards at any point in your turn, but only from cards in your hand.  
COINS: Coins allow you to PURCHASE additional cards from the SUPPLY. The large number in the center of the card represents the cards purchasing power. The number in the lower right corner represents the number of coins needed to purchase the card.
POPULATION: The number in blue on the bottom of all population cards represents its population value. To win the game simply add up all population cards that are placed correctly in your empire. The player with the highest population wins. Remember that only the cards correctly placed in the empire count toward your score.  
ATTACK/DEFEND: Using Attack/Defense cards are optional to gameplay.  If you want to add a bit more chaos and bite to your game then use these cards.  Empires of Steam has 3 attack cards and 1 defend card. To play an attack card, it needs to be one of the 5 cards drawn from your deck. Place your card next to your opponent’s card you wish to attack. This card will remain until the opponent shows a defend card, at which time you will retrieve the attack card and place it immediately into your discard pile. The DEFEND card can be shown at the same time as the initial attack or as soon as the player draws their DEFEND card from their DRAW pile. Whenever the DEFEND card is shown, then the ATTACK card goes directly to the DISCARD pile. The DEFEND card remains in the player’s hand If the opponent has the attack card in place at the end of the game, any cards beyond the attacked cards will not count toward their final population score.  
EACH TURN: During each turn you are allowed 1 MANEUVER, 1 PURCHASE and up to 3 PLACES. Additional MANEUVERS and PURCHASES can be obtained thru the MANEUVER phase.  
Notes  
POPULATION/MANEUVER cards while in your hand use the “abilities” of the card to gain extra maneuvers, purchases or coins. These population values cannot be used toward a winning total.  
When POPULATION/MANEUVER cards are placed into an empire, their abilities can no longer be used, but the population values count toward your final winning population total.  
Source of Water: Many cards require a source of water. Unless otherwise noted, as long as an empire has a source of water, then it is sufficient for the entire empire. Cards do not need their own individual source of water.  
“Exclusively”: A few cards require exclusive use. For example, the Grand Hall card requires a sky platform exclusively. No other cards can use the same sky platform as the Grand Hall. To continue to build that empire, another sky platform will need to be added. Remember, you are not limited to just one land or one Ocean Empire. These empires can be numerous.
 Normal version  
As soon as (3) “Grand Hall” cards have been placed into any empire the game is over. At this time, each player totals their population points that are correctly placed into their empires. The player with the highest population total wins.  
Timed Version
2 players – highest population totals after 15 minutes  
3 players – highest population totals after 20 minutes  
4 players – highest population totals after 30 minutes
 Turn 1
  Each player starts the game with 5 coin cards in their DRAW deck. At the beginning of each turn, a player draws the top 5 cards from their DRAW deck. Begin each turn with the MANEUVER phase. On your first turn, there are no maneuvers so move to the next phase of your turn, the PURCHASE phase. Total all coins in your HAND and from your MANEUVERED cards. On your first turn there are no MANEUVERED cards so you have 5 coins to make a PURCHASE. With 5 coins, PURCHASE any card from the SUPPLY and discard the new card and your coin cards to the DISCARD pile. Next draw the next 5 cards from the DRAW pile. Because there are no cards in your DRAW pile, shuffle the cards from your DISCARD pile and place them in the DRAW pile. This ends your first turn.
Turn 2
At the end of your previous turn, you should have drawn a new hand of 5 cards from your DRAW pile. Let’s assume that in your hand are now 4 coin cards and 1 card from the SUPPLY. With this new turn, you have a MANEUVER, PURCHASE and PLACE available. Let’s also assume the card you purchased from TURN 1 gives you an additional coin. With your MANEUVER, play your card, gaining an additional coin. With the other 4 coins in your hand you can now PURCHASE another card worth up to 5 coins. PURCHASE a new card from the SUPPLY. With no more MANEUVERS or PURCHASES, discard all cards to the DISCARD pile. Next draw another 5 cards from the DRAW pile. Because there are not enough cards, shuffle all the cards in your DISCARD pile and place them under the cards in your DRAW pile. Now you have enough to draw a complete HAND. This ends your second turn.
Turn 3
At the end of your previous turn, you should have drawn a new hand of 5 cards from your DRAW pile. Let’s assume that in your hand are now 3 coin cards and 2 cards from the SUPPLY. With this new turn, you have a MANEUVER, PURCHASE and PLACE available. Let’s also assume the 2 cards now give you an extra coin and an extra MANEUVER. First place the MANEUVER card. This gives you an additional MANEUVER, allowing you to play the card gaining you another coin. As you build your HAND, you may be able to play several cards as long as you gain enough additional MANEUVERS to play the extra cards. Once you play all your cards or run out of MANEUVERS, then total up your additional PURCHASES and coins. PURCHASE additional cards from the SUPPLY and place them in the DISCARD pile. PLACE cards into your empire at any point in the turn if you wish. Again, draw another 5 cards from the DRAW pile. This ends your turn.
Turn X
At the end of your previous turn, you should have drawn a new hand of 5 cards from your DRAW pile. Continue to play cards from your HAND thru MANEUVERS. Gain additional MANEUVERS, PURCHASES and coins, thus growing your deck. Also consider strategic times to PLACE cards into your empire. Also consider times to use ATTACK cards to slow the growth of your opponents. Your opponents may also use ATTACK cards so keep defend cards on hand as well. Again, draw another 5 cards from the DRAW pile. This ends your turn.

Deluxe content features the mini-expansion Quest for the Golden Mushrooms! In this mini-expansion the goblins have captured some of the most magical mushroom folk of the land and the heroes that can rescue them will be generously rewarded! 
Quest for the Golden Mushrooms adds a capture-the-flag element to Tiny Epic Quest, as well as some additional variability through the addition of Golden Grotto Map Cards!
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
Tiny Epic Quest is the classic story of a fairy tale world overrun by evil and in need of heroes... that's where you come in!
Tiny Epic Quest is a competitive game, where each player controls a band of three heroes and will travel a vast world fighting goblins, learning spells, completing quests and acquiring powerful magic items!
The world is made up of 17 map cards, each offering two locations, a left side, and a right side, for a total of 34 locations.
The layout of the world and the locations of the player castles are the same each game, however the locations of the temples, spells and goblins are unique each game.
Travel is handled by a limited-action-selection system offering five distinct forms of grid-movement of which only four will be used each round, during the day phase. 
During the day phase, players are also competing to complete puzzles as shown on three public quest cards. The first player to complete the puzzle by positioning their heroes accordingly collect the quest card and its benefits. 
  Each round is broken down into two phases, the day phase and the night phase.
  In the night phase, players will roll adventure dice in a communal press-your-luck fashion to try to accomplish the tasks at the locations they ended at during the day phase. This could be fighting a goblin, learning a spell, or delving into a temple. But be careful, if you take too much damage you may exhaust and lose all that round's progress and more! 
Players keep track of their heroes' collective health, power and progress on personal adventure logs.
And when you acquire powerful items, you equip them right to your ITEMeeples™! 
Players keep track of their spell progress, and the rounds magic level on a community magic mat. As the round's magic increases, goblins become more threatening and even your own power turns from good to bad!
After five rounds, the game is over. While you may not have single handedly saved the world, did you accomplish more than the other players? Whoever has the most points in the end from goblins killed, spells learned, quests accomplished, and legendary items acquired, wins the game!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We're proud to say that we are prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 75% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with our long time partners Panda Game Manufacturing. Who we've worked with on over 10 separate projects and have a great relationship with. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with Ship Naked again for project fulfillment. Having worked with them for over 4 years, we are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled all our projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Quest to game tables all around the world!

campaign.story:
American Sunset is a tabletop roleplaying game set in a fictional American West, featuring:
A setting that combines the larger-than-life characters and the western film genre with true history issues and hardships.
A simple and flexible system, accessible to beginners but with the depth to satisfy veteran roleplayers.
A detailed world, perfect for your choice of western-film style campaigns, historically driven games, or fantastical "weird west" adventures.
The World of American Sunset
The War of the Rebellion is over and the push to colonize the West is only stronger for it. Displaced veterans and ex-slaves are traveling west in search of a new life, and immigrants from across the Atlantic are spilling out of East Coast cities, searching for liberty on the frontier.
Map by Stuart Baxter-Potter
The more territory that is mapped and claimed in these final years of expansion, the more native tribes are forced away from their lands and traditions. Soldiers, encouraged and supplied by the United States government, are in open war with Native Americans who refuse to give up their homes without a fight.
Art by Cameron Cseko Cameroncseko93@gmail.com
Silver Springs is a city in heart of Jefferson State, the most recent to be admitted into the Union. The last stop before the edge of the map, every two-bit bandit and hopeful frontiersman in the West has walked these dusty streets, as well as every legendary outlaw and every prospector who's struck it rich.
Meanwhile, stranger things lurk in the remote fringes of the frontier, waiting to be discovered. Folk tales and legends speak of strange monsters, places that resist being found, and people with impossible powers.
Art by Cameron Cseko Cameroncseko93@gmail.com
Now, you and your party step into this world. How will you make your mark on the West?
American Sunset is inspired by both Western films and books, as well as the true-life history of the American West. No small amount of research went into the creation of the American Sunset setting, and the system is designed to reinforce the themes of the Western.
Playing the Game
Combat is tense and fast paced, with conflict resolution built around do-or-die scenarios. Character creation is devised to so that players can create fully realized characters with their own reputation and destiny right out of the starting gate.
Art by Calida Howell
Reputation itself is a powerful force in American Sunset, and player characters can take advantage of this by using their influence, whatever it may be, to re-shape the world around them. After performing incredible, improbable, or extraordinary feats, characters can call upon the stories of their accomplishments to bolster (or diminish!) their odds.
In addition, a versatile combat system allows verbal sparring to happen seamlessly alongside fistfights and shootouts. Rhetorical strategies and arguments provide a way for socially-oriented characters to stay relevant even in combat-heavy campaigns. 
Mechanics Demo
PLAY

  With funding from Kickstarter we will continue development of the system. With more time, we can polish mechanics, add depth to the setting, and commission more art.
Even more importantly, when funded, we will print and distribute hard copies of American Sunset to everyone who has supported us at the "Book and PDF" level or higher. Books that we ship will be soft cover with full color illustrations, filled with everything you need to play and run a campaign.

Donate more than $25, and you will receive a print copy of the game once it's fully completed. Our current plan is to print the book in softcover, with full-color illustrations. At the moment, our alpha build is approximately 100 pages, but we expect that the final version of the book will be at least 150.

 Game Play Video by Dean Brown...
  Day 1 Mounted Map Special!
Many Kickstarter campaigns have "early bird" specials. Basically, the first people to pledge get some kind of discount or exclusive item.
Instead of taking that approach, if we can reach $10,000 in the first 24 hours, we will upgrade the game's huge 33" x 17" Mission Display from heavy paper to a Mounted Map Board! By doing things this way, everyone benefits, and it becomes a team effort.
B-17 Flying Fortress Leader is a solitaire game.
You select and command Bomber Groups and Fighter Groups belonging to the US 8th Air Force as you carry out a strategic bombing campaign against German Occupied Europe.
As you plan and carry out your missions, the game's AI controls the German Air Defenses, Technology improvements, and allocation of resources to the European, Mediterranean, and Russian campaigns.
B-17 is a Dean Brown design. He has worked closely with us to make sure B-17 is faithful to the Air Leader series, while at the same time having its own unique flavor!
You begin by selecting a Campaign sheet. Each Campaign details the year of your aerial campaign, point values of different types, objective, and special rules that make the campaign unique.
You then select your Bomber Group cards, Fighter Group cards, and any Renowned Commanders you would like to have command them.
It is then time to set-up the initial German resources and air defenses that you will be flying through.
During each Mission, you select which Target card you wish to attack, plot a flight path to and from the target based on what you think the best path through the defenses is, and then resolve the Mission.
During the Mission, you'll move your Bomber Formation and Fighter Escorts one leg of the flight at a time to the target, checking to see if you encounter German fighters, "Bandits", and resolving the air engagements along the way.
During these battles, your Escorts will do their best to shield your Bombers from the swarming Bandits, but some might slip through. At which point it will be up to your gunners to destroy the incoming fighters, or at least driving them off.
While at the same time, the Bandits will be doing their best to shoot down your Bombers.
As you approach the Target, you'll lead your Bombers through deadly fields of flak guns before being able to drop your bombs.
Once over target, you'll call out "Bombs Away!" as you rain destruction down on the factories below!
It is then time for the long flight home. Hopefully, the enemy fighters will not have had enough time to land, rearm, and take off again to intercept you on your home-bound journey.
It is up to you to inflict maximum damage on Germany's war-making capability, while at the same time bringing your brave crews home.
 At the Strategic Level, you will need to decide which Bomber and Fighter Groups to purchase. You will also need to decide how to spend your limited resources. Should you repair damaged aircraft? Purchase another Group? Purchase Technology upgrades to help you complete Missions? And more.
You will also see the German Air Defense strategy alter as they decide to either keep or replace their current Air Defense Commander. Each historical Commander has his own style, skills, and abilities. The AI will also move German resources around to add another layer of decision making to the game.
Each Mission provides an attack by attack telling of the heroic action. Waves of enemy Bandits will clash with your Fighter Escorts in their desperate attempt to reach your Bombers. If any Bandits reach your Bombers, only the marksmanship of your Gunners will prevent the Bandits from shooting down your Bombers.
Each Mission unfolds like a classic WWII movie. B-17 provides enough details to bring you into the action, without adding so much complication that it takes you out of the story.
Each Mission takes only 15 to 20 minutes to resolve.

Risks and challenges
Dan Verssen Games (DVG) has the knowledge and skills to ensure that everything goes as smoothly as possible. We have published dozens of games. If you have any questions or queries, the people at DVG will be here to assist you as quickly as we can. If you would like to see the quality of the games we publish, please visit our website:

campaign.story:
Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave is a stand-alone expansion to the hit solitaire game from 2015!
A rash of crime is hitting the city. Most crimes don't require a negotiator. But for the ones that do... you get the call. 
Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave is completely playable without any other content. So if you don't own the original Hostage Negotiator, you are still getting a fully playable game right out of the box. But having the original as well really brings out the most in this expansion! With new Conversation Cards, new Terror Cards, new Pivotal Events, new Abductors, and new Demands that can all be integrated with the original, your Hostage Negotiator experience will be taken to an all new level! Plus, with a larger box that can easily fit all released content -including the entire original game box- with room for more, you won't have to worry about any storage concerns whatsoever. But you'll still have the portability option of the original for taking on trips!
The box is designed to hold all of the Hostage Negotiator content released so far (with room for more!).
  We are very proud to say that Hostage Negotiator has garnered much praise over the last year and has a very good reputation with the Solitaire community.
2015 Solitaire Game of the Year - 1 Player Guild
Has over 5,000 members!
2015 Golden Geek Nominee and Runner Up for best Solitaire Game
Runner Up
  If you already know how the original plays, you can skip to the next section to find out what is new. But if you're new to the game, here is how it works.
Object of the Game: Your goal as a Hostage Negotiator is to save the hostages and have the crisis end with the Abductor’s capture or elimination. To win, at least half of the hostages must escape with their lives AND the Abductor must be captured or eliminated.  
Here is what the game looks like set up on your table...  
The Game plays over multiple turns with each turn being comprised of 3 phases.   
1. The Conversation Phase - this is where you play and resolve conversation cards from your hand by making a Threat Roll to influence the Abductor's Threat Level, earn Conversation Points, and save hostages. Thematically, this phase represents the back and forth dialogue between you and the abductor. Perhaps a calm conversation... or... a tense and heated exchange depending on the cards played and the results. It could also represent actions such as sending in a field team to extract some hostages while you occupy the abductor.  
During the Conversation Phase you play the “Little Compromises” card. The Threat level is currently on 4, so you roll two Threat dice. You get 1 success which allows you gain a Conversation Point, reduce the Threat by 1, and save 1 Hostage.
2. The Spend Phase - this is your chance to spend any Conversation Points you may have earned in the Conversation Phase. Similar to a deck building game you will buy cards from the available area on the table, but in this game all the cards you buy go directly into your hand for use in the next or another future turn. Thematically this represents the conversational equity you've built up with the Abductor by influencing her (or him!) and/or keeping her on the phone longer so you and your command can plan a potential use of force!  
During the Spend Phase you can purchase available Conversation Cards. "All snipers engage targets!" is a very powerful card that can end the game with one shot, but it doesn't come cheap. You'll need at least 7 Conversation Points in order to purchase it.
3. The Terror Phase - this is where you will draw and resolve a Terror Card. In general, bad things will happen putting pressure on the Threat Level or worse... losing one or more hostages. Thematically this represents the Abductor's (or sometimes another individual such as a hostage's) actions between conversations. Maybe the Abductor decides he/she is angry or that you are not listening to his demands. Or maybe a hostage attempts to escape! The number of cards in the Terror Deck are limited to represent the ticking of the clock... after all, the Abductor has only given you a limited amount of time to meet his/her demands! The above is only a general summary of play, but we hope it gives you a good idea of the game. There are other details not discussed here such as Demands, the Pivotal Event Terror Card, the 2nd in Command, and more! 
During the Terror Phase you must reveal the top card on the Terror Deck. In this example, you drew “Fit of Rage,” which will temporarily raise the Threat level by 2 as your Abductor throws a dangerous – and costly – temper tantrum.
We strongly suggest you take a look at the FULL RULES for the game by clicking the image below.

Van Ryder Games has successfully funded and fulfilled several projects. We learn more and more with each experience. Our goal is to get the games to you, our supporters, as quickly as possible.

If we are so fortunate to run through our planned stretch reward offerings prior to the end of the project we will not add more on the fly. campaign.story:
A NEW STRETCH-GOAL OF $16,392!!!
When a Kickstarter project achieves its funding goal before the end of a campaign period, a stretch goal is introduced to maximize the fundraising potential. Kickstarter takes a 5% cut of the raised funds. Amazon Payments takes another 3%. So although I have been raising $15,080 (the annual federal minimum wage), I’ll actually receive $1,206 less than that. I am grateful for such an amazing platform to introduce my dream to the world and don’t mind sacrificing for the privilege. Now though, I would like to raise $16,392 so that after the 8% is taken out, I will still be left with the actual minimum wage amount of $15,080.
The video says it best, but The Rolling Bard is a viewer-driven online storytelling road trip adventure web series to be published every Saturday morning for an entire year on YouTube! I'm trying to shoot for July 23, 2016 for the launch date. To learn more, watch my video or send me a message.
A sprawling day at "the office" glorious whipping wind and weather! Just enough to make me feel alive without hurting my little Bonsai (Bob).
Sample Themes: Here are a couple examples of what an episode might focus on for a given week.
1) I want to discuss and share experiences with my fellow military veterans. I’m just one Marine with a combat deployment and I know others with five. My deployment felt like the experiential equivalent of 10 years. In the first weeks, we developed the heightened senses needed for combat. The colors were brighter, our emotions were stronger, and we lived with every ounce of our ability. With the suffering came incredible joy, love and friendship. Then we were returned home and were asked to exist in a world that was grey and lifeless by comparison. It’s now been five years since my return from Afghanistan, and it may as well have been yesterday. I can still put on my combat gloves, press my face to my hands and inhale deeply, taking in the smell of memory, of war, and of the most intoxicating high I have ever felt. The floodgates of my mind’s deepest vaults start to creak open, and with razor sharp clarity, I’m back in the poppy fields of Sangin.
A hero named PFC Ibarra watches over me while I speak Pashto with some local Afghans. He was welcomed through the gates of Valhalla a few days later.
2) Employees of the Food Service industry are the most hardworking, intelligent, generous, and crazy group of people I’ve had the privilege of working with. I’d like to bring you into that world. We work terrible hours for no money with the good faith that our fellow man will, abide by the culture to tip us for our efforts. What isn’t given enough attention is the back burner, not the one on the stove, but the place where servers, bartenders, bussers and dishwashers keep the dreams they are fighting for. We chose this work for a reason, and the fighting spirit I’ve seen in those hustling for their life’s greater ambition is beautiful. 
One of my best friends Shani (a fellow server in DC), on the day we dreamed up this adventure and I began to think it was possible (June 2015)
Support with Significance: Support given to this campaign or throughout the year will be shared. Let’s give this money meaning beyond food, gas and van modifications. I want to make room in the budget for random acts of kindness, to honor unsung heroes, and to reach out from wherever you are in the world and impact lives. You will have direct input as to when and how this happens. My vision is that you all have an active role in our community-driven project.
Coffee with a Stranger: I will either be buying or making coffee (or tea for the Irish) for 365 strangers throughout the year. With their permission, I’ll take also take their photo and create a mini-profile of the person and our conversation and upload it to social media/the website.
Be the Bard: The Rolling Bard will host free potluck story sessions in different locations around the country, where storytellers and fans can share the magic of live storytelling. You can always come for the free food and stories, but if you want to do it right, be the bard and tell your own story.
What a pretty picture!
Your Music/Our Mix-tape: I want the entire soundtrack for this series to come from all of you. Once this project is funded, I will work to make it easy for you to upload your tracks for consideration. My great Irish friend’s band supplied the main track for this first video! It’s called “Winter15”. His band’s Facebook & Sound Cloud links are here: https://www.facebook.com/castlestreetband/, https://soundcloud.com/castle-street/ I sampled from another friend’s track for the introduction to the video and that song is called, “Lucid Fugitive” and is an awesome full-song too! Check out ‘Fifty Shades’ Sound Cloud here: https://soundcloud.com/fifty-shades
Videography Credits: Ryan Patch (Storyteller's Ink) Shot all footage from Washington, DC.
A Short History of the Rolling Bard: The dream to become a bard was born in Ireland. I lived there for nine months while I studied Mandarin and International Development at an Irish University. I loved Ireland, but the death of a close friend brought me to the realization that waiting for any amount of time to live out my dream was a waste of my time. I flew to Washington, DC, absolutely broke, and found a rent-free room four blocks from the White House (with a nudist hoarder as a roommate) and worked in my fourth and fifth restaurants while I planned for this day. A year later I left DC, took out a loan and bought a used cargo van. Another restaurant and a few months of planning sessions later … bring us to today!
There are no 'bad tripods'.
Thanks to all who have been patiently helping me to review my plans and special thanks to Sandra for giving more than anyone else could. This project is dedicated to Frederic.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As of right now, I have nothing else on my plate but this project. No health concerns, no relationships, and no fear. A solo-yearlong trip around America is fraught with obstacles and challenges too numerous to list. Just like the Marine Corps taught me, I will adapt and overcome and no matter what, I promise I've been through worse. Friends, this is a labor of love. I have never in my life lost so much sleep over sheer excitement! Though I expect to struggle, fail, and be frustrated. Dreams aren't dreams for being easy.

Specifically: After the project is funded I expect to take about three weeks to work out administrative issues and planning associated with the many moving parts, which a project like this will require. I have an awesome team so far and will be seeking help continuously!

A few things I need to buy with some of the Kickstarter money are:

Van Modifications: Just the basics (will network for local labor & help).
Insulation, ventilation, a backup battery, a bed frame, shelving, a food cooler, a washbasin, and a curtain.
*As I will be using salvaged wood and hitting up rummage sales for what I need, the costs are hard to define but will be low.

Equipment: (Hopefully to be Rented/Loaned/Sponsored)
Tripod (≈$30), 2-3 lavaliere microphones (≈$120ea), and a motorized 360-degree tripod head (≈$100)
*I also would love to get FinalCutPro ($300), and Woowave DreamSync ($200).

I should be covered for anything else.

updates.update_userinfo: A Grateful Heart, A Stretch-Goal of $16,392, & A VidCon Update!
updates.update_content:
A Glorious Happy Friday to All!
Yesterday was one for the books, a day in my life to be remembered forever. Yes. The Rolling Bard’s Kickstarter goal of $15,080 was funded yesterday! “Round of Applause!”

Dear all,
When I woke up this morning I noticed that the 'time remaining' on Kickstarter was suddenly measured in hours and not days!
The project is 90% funded and so to cross the finish line, I created two special limited (10 each) reward tiers of $50 and $100! What will I do?

updates.update_userinfo: An Update, A Story, Some Inspiration & More!
updates.update_content:
To My 117 Wonderful Backers,
Since my last update from Kansas, I have arrived in California! What?!?...I can hear you say. Yes, it was a lot of driving. I arrived at 11:00pm Pacific Time, found an Anytime Fitness near to the site of VidCon, showered and passed out. I am so grateful that I don’t have to drive through the desert anymore. My van was getting hot and I had to slow down several times to keep the temperature gauge in a safe range. Once we left higher ground and hit the glorious multi-mile stretch of downward sloping road, my van was back and zipping along with the startlingly fast California traffic!

updates.update_userinfo: Mmmm... Life on the road is bliss.
updates.update_content: Hello everyone!

updates.update_userinfo: The Rolling Bard hits the road!
updates.update_content:
A most joyous greeting to my generous backers!
I am a bit exhausted from the emotional roller coaster of sensory overload, which has been the first week of this campaign. With your pledges came your trust, a few inspiring stories, and the infusion this dream needed to spring to life!
We are shockingly close to the campaign goal after only one week. I needed to pack last night, but found myself staring into space for an hour, stunned, trying to comprehend the outpouring of love, generosity, and encouragement that has flooded into my world since this campaign began.

updates.update_userinfo: Here today, gone tomorrow! Plus a new video just for you!
updates.update_content:
Greetings to all of my Backers!
Thank you for your patience in waiting for this update. As you know I’m leaving in less than 48 hours to begin a one-way journey to California for VidCon. My plan has always been to begin this journey without knowing the financial status of the project. I’m committed to this direction for my life and the last few days have been both scary and exciting! In less than a week of generous support, we find ourselves with almost two thirds of the funding completed! Amazing. I’m humbled and honored by your generosity. As a thank you, I made you another video! I created this one so that we can get to know each other better, but please share/post it if you think it will help! It’s on my YouTube Channel as well.

campaign.story:
Hello Kickstarter backers & community! We're pleased to present our project, the Brilliant Mug! The Brilliant mug is perfect for two audiences:
1. For bars, clubs, and restaurants, the Brilliant Mug is a functional product that alerts staff when a customer needs another drink. It's also great for setting ambiance and creating a stunning environment!
2. For everyday consumers, the Brilliant Mug is a fun product that's great for events, parties, gifts, holidays, camping, weddings and more! It's also perfect when relaxing in the pool or hot tub because it's completely waterproof!! We've even used them as lamps when the power went out!
Our mugs are beautiful high-quality products; the glass mugs are ideal for less accident-prone environments, while our polycarbonate mugs are nearly indestructible and perfect for high risk environments (great for kids!!).
Personalize your Brilliant Mugs! We did!
How It Works
The Brilliant mug continually monitors the user's drink and will trigger when the drink is nearing empty. We've designed the Brilliant Mug with different functionalities in mind. Users can configure jumpers on the bottom of the mug to achieve desired modes. To have the mug illuminated while drinking and change to a different color when nearing empty, just use the "Standard" mode. This is the default mode our mugs are configured to when shipped. If you prefer not to have lights on while drinking, but want the mug to illuminate when nearing empty, use the "Fill 'Er Up" mode by removing only the P2 jumper on the bottom of the mug. We've also included an additional mode for fun. This mode is called "Party's Over". In this mode, the lights will stay illuminated until the drink is nearing empty, at which point the lights turn off. Remove only the P1 jumper to set the mug to this mode. To replace the battery, just remove the silicone plug on the bottom of the mug. We recommend using a small flat-head screwdriver to remove the battery and jumpers. 
Engineering
We, the developers of the Brilliant Mug, are engineers with more than 25 years of experience in the aerospace industry. We're meticulous when it comes to developing products, and have spent the past 2 years perfecting the design, functionality, and fabrication process of the Brilliant Mug. In addition to being aesthetically stunning, we've designed the Brilliant Mug to be highly efficient. Each battery lasts roughly 300 hours depending on color and configuration. We've made several revisions to the Brilliant Mug and wanted to be sure we had a solid product prior to launching our Kickstarter campaign. We use only food-grade epoxy and silicone for the Brilliant Mug so you can rest assured there are no hazardous chemicals to worry about. 
Product Care
Do not freeze (polycarbonate version is ok to freeze)
Do not microwave
Do not use with hot liquids (may degrade mug over time)  
Hand wash only (dish-washing may degrade mug over time)
Help us Launch the Brilliant Mug
We need your help! We need your backing and social media support so we can begin to mass produce the Brilliant Mug. Any help provided is greatly appreciated! Like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram and share with your friends!
We've worked tirelessly with suppliers to ensure we'll receive the best pricing on supplies without having to order massive quantities. This is how we're able to launch our campaign with a backer amount of only $10,000! Funds awarded will be used as follows: 
Printed Circuit Board Assemblies ($3000)
Polycarbonate & Glass Mugs ($2000)
Estimated shipping costs ($3000)
Various components, epoxy, etc ($1000)
Other costs ($1000)
Thank you again for your support!
Project Timeline
Pending a successful Kickstarter campaign, we plan to ship Brilliant Mugs beginning October 2016!  
We've also been thinking about variations of the Brilliant Mug. If successfully funded, we can begin to explore these options as well! 
Highball / Pint Glass 
Tumbler 
Margarita / Martini

campaign.story:
Welcome to Campaign Trail, for a quick overview of what's new since we started, see our most recent update here. 
Campaign Trail is a card driven action game set in the world of modern electoral politics. You are a candidate for president, with a war chest to spend and a cadre of supporters and registered voters all willing to help you gain the electoral votes necessary to get to the White House!
During our hundreds of playtests, the players have commented on the following aspects as items they enjoyed the most:
The multi-use cards create many excellent decision possibilities
You know exactly who is leading at all times due to the real time electoral vote tracker
Each unique candidate ability opens up new areas of strategy
The design that takes partisan politics out and gives a fun, enriching experience
Please check out the rulebook and print and play files to see how Campaign Trail uses multi-function cards inspired by La Granja and Bruges and an area control mechanic similar to games like Twilight Struggle and 1960: The Making of the President.
Money Back Guarantee
Because we stand behind this game and are confident you will enjoy it, we are adopting the Stonemaier Games Money Back Guarantee. If you are unhappy with Campaign Trail for any reason, just return it to us within 1 month of receiving it and we will issue you a full refund.
We've hit our funding goal and are now working on unlocking these stretch goals! We have a mini-expansion and a solo play variant that we're really excited to bring to you.
    Components not shown to scale. The items shown are an artist's depiction and may not reflect the exact specifications of the final product.
A picture of the cubes from the retail version compared with the mini-meeples and 3-count full size meeples from the deluxe version.
   Dan from GameBoyGeek gives a good how to play overview here:
You can learn how to play in just 3 easy steps:
1. Play a card from your hand and decide which action to take
    2. If you have the most voters in a state, you control that state and count it's electoral votes toward your total.  
3. After three rounds, the player with the most electoral votes is the new President!
You're vying for electoral votes and not all states are the same. Plan your strategy and execute your plan so that you win the more valuable states and leave your opponents with only the small states!
Please download our rules and playtest files to try it out for yourself or log on to Tabletopia by clicking the picture below to play with friends online (requires Firefox, IE, or Safari and the Unity Player installed):
          Click each quote below to go to the review:
      To get multiple copies of Campaign Trail, please select one of the add-on options below:
Additional Retail copies - Add $49 to your pledge for each additional copy (plus $0, $3, $8, $13, or $20 shipping charge for each copy depending on your location)
Additional Deluxe copies - Add $69 to your pledge for each additional copy (plus $0, $3, $8, $13, or $20 shipping charge for each copy depending on your location)
How to add to your pledge:
1. Click the "Manage" button on the right side of the window under "You're a backer!"
2. Click "Change your pledge"
3. Enter new pledge amount and click "Continue"
4. Click "Confirm" on the pop-up window and you're all done. You will have an option on the end of campaign reward survey to indicate how many additional copies you pledged for.
We believe that there is a place for Campaign Trail in our educational system, helping to teach kids how our election system works in a fun, enjoyable way. Thus we want to get the game into as many schools as we can.
For every 25 backers we get on this project, we will donate 1 copy of Campaign Trail to a school nominated by you and voted on by you. 
Here's how this works:
1. Any backer can nominate a school of your choice using our nomination form (click the link). As part of the nomination, record a 1 to 2 minute video explaining why this school is deserving (this can be about the teachers, students, etc) and send to jeff@cosmicwombatgames.com
2. We will post the nomination videos in a public forum so that all our backers can have access to the information.
3. When the campaign ends we will ask each of our backers to vote for their top 5 schools from all the nominations listed. 
4. We will select the top vote getters (1 school for every 25 backers) and send them a retail copy of Campaign Trail when it is released.
Note: This will only go into affect should the campaign fund successfully. 
We have chosen to use the Stonemaier Games shipping and distribution method so our shipping is EU, Australia, and Canada friendly. We have tried to make the shipping as affordable as possible. The US shipping is included in the base pledge amount. That same amount is credited to all countries to help offset their shipping charges. Any additional amount will be added to your pledge at checkout.
See chart below for shipping amounts:
Note: Hong Kong and Taiwan should be in the $8 additional shipping tier. We apologize for not including them originally. If you are from one of these countries go ahead and pledge, Kickstarter will charge you $20, we will then issue you a refund of $12 at the end of the campaign.
Design: David Cornelius - Campaign Trail was designed by our dad before either of us were born. His love of politics and strategy board games led him to come up with a card play system that placed influence in states where players worked to win the electoral college. 
It existed on a posterboard game board with index cards and paper score sheets. But it was fun.
Development: Nathan and Jeff Cornelius - We are the founders and creative team behind Cosmic Wombat Games. We have always wanted to take our dad's game and turn it into a modern boardgame. We have been working on developing the game for the last five years.
Illustration/Graphic Design: Chris Strain - Chris has been an illustrator and graphic designer for 14 years. He is also an accomplished game designer of his own. His credits include Evil Intent and Asking for Trobils. We knew on this relaunch that we would need some professional help with the graphic design and layout of Campaign Trail. Chris has brought that and more, giving the game a new modern look and feel with a minimalist design philosophy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we do have one successfull Kickstarter under our belt, we do realize we are very new to this. This is why we are working with established names in the Kickstarter community who have delivered projects on time. 

We are printing through Panda Game Manufacturing. They have delivered on many Kickstarters in the past few years and are very experienced in what it takes to make a game in a timely manner.

We are using the same shipping and distribution system that Stonemaier games uses. This gives us confidence that our games will be delivered on time and in great condition. 

We look forward to bringing this game to you. Our goal is to get it to you by election day, 2016. However, we do realize this is a very aggresive schedule. We will do everything in our power to make sure this happens. Thanks for trusting us to bring you this game.

Note: This game is not affiliated with or a continuation of the game of the same name published by GDW Games in 1983. We have spoken with a lawyer and have determined it is within our legal rights to publish under the name Campaign Trail.

What is your time worth to you and to your family?
As we all know - it is priceless! Time it is something you will never ever get back again. So please allow us to show and share with you how we can prolong some of your memorable moments. With Kvits you will add more valuable time to your life journey. Yet, your dining experience will never be the same and we guarantee it!
What is Kvits?
Kvits is a payment platform where patrons can pay their bills at restaurants, bars, cafes and more, all without waiting for a server with a push of a button on your smart device. With Kvits you can split your bill among other guests, add a tip and even rate the service you received. Well, restaurants are a great way to spend time with friends and family, but if you dine out often, then you know how long it can take to pay for a meal. Even if your server is a pro, they still need to ask if you finished and would like a check, bring it to you, and then process the card and/or give back change. Fortunately, we have created a way to avoid these 3 steps with Kvits, now you can pay your bill whenever you and your party are ready to leave – it’s dining on your own terms!
How Does it Work?
Simple! As for the end user, all you have to do is download an app and with a push of a button you can be out to your next destination avoiding the frustration of 3 Waits. On the other end there is a secured software which consists of various numbers, letters, characters and all kinds of algorithms that is in the process of being developed for integration to Point of Sale (POS) systems. But we don't want you to worry about it, so we will not bore you with this information. Basically, the Kvits platform syncs with a restaurant’s POS system and processes transactions in real time. All you have to do is just input or scan your table’s unique identification number and pay your check via Kvits app simply by using one of your major credit cards or alternative payment services such as Paypal, Apple Pay, and traditional gift cards. And guess what? You just saved and added more valuable time for your precious moments and avoided the unnecessary frustration. How? Because now you are in charge!
The Impact
As a customer with Kvits:
Now you are in charge of your own time avoiding the 3 Waits! 
No waiting to call for a server to ask for a check! 
No waiting for a server to bring a check! 
No waiting for a server to bring a change or a credit card back! 
Split the check between other guests or pay all by yourself. Choice is all yours.
You can add a tip with a tap of the screen.
You will be out to your next destination faster avoiding unnecessary frustration.
Significantly reduces the waiting time to get seated.
You will never be publicly embarrassed by a declined card again.
You can rate the services and leave instantaneous feedback for the owner's or management's personal review.
Restaurants benefit with: 
Tables turn faster, which increases sales up to 55%
Streamlined service – servers no longer have to double back from table to table with checks, freeing up time to perform other tasks.
Lower wait times – tables will pay faster and leave more quickly, reducing the wait times for others.
Higher customer satisfaction – diners will be impressed with your state-of-the-art system, and will remember your establishment over traditional restaurants with longer wait times.
Internal data compiling – Kvits generates automatic reports and statistics to track promotions and other crucial information, helping you stay connected with your restaurant’s needs in real time.
Other Ways to Help
It's great when people can help pledge, but if you can't pledge at this time, it doesn't mean that you can't help. Please share our story via social media, email and word-of-mouth to tell your friends about this amazing campaign that will help them to save one of the most precious things in life, which is TIME and fill it with more valuable moments. Be sure to keep an eye out for the Kvits webpage www.kvits.com , where you can sign up to our newsletter and for the chance to win a $1000 gift card! Thank you in advance!
Follow us!

www.twitter.com/KvitsTime

Keep It Clean With The Clean Cover!
Good Day Sacramento/CBS
Grooming yourself is important, but who has the time or patience to clean up the hairy mess that's left behind!  
If You Cut Hair,Shave or Apply Makeup Over The Bathroom Sink This Is For YOU!
Introducing The Clean Cover Hair Mat a product specifically designed to help with this issue:
Benefits:
*Saves Time (cuts down clean up process by 98%)
*Saves Money (expensive pluming cost from clogged drains)
*Groom And Go!!
*Spotless Outcome Every Time
*No more complaints over a messy bathroom!!
*Detachable Hood for Wet/Dry shave
*Two Side Pockets for combs and brushes
*Washable (dry's in less than 5 mins)
*Folds into pouch
*Fits in shaving Bag
*Perfect for travel
*Perfect for Any gift!!
The Clean Cover was designed to keep your bathroom spotless of hair clippings or makeup particles from landing all over the sink.
AFTER DRY SHAVE, WET SHAVE, HAIR CUT OR APPLYING MAKEUP..SPOTLESS!!!
 As a person who cuts his hair and shaves over the sink regularly, I wanted to find a faster, more convenient way to groom and go. The clean up process was far to annoying and time consuming. The Clean Cover Hair Mat was made to save you time and consistently maintain a clean,organized bathroom! The name Clean Cover was chosen because it fits the dilemma that was once a problem. I needed something to keep the bathroom CLEAN and something to COVER the sink.
CLEAN COVER HAIR MAT
The mat covers the entire sink area with a hood made to go over the knobs to prevent any loose hair or makeup from falling in between. The hood was designed to fit any style or size sink. For wet shave the hood can be detached with a velcro connection allowing running water to go down the drain. It also has two pockets on each side for storage of brushes, combs, razors or makeup.
THE CLEAN COVER HAIR MAT IS UNIVERSAL BOTH MEN AND WOMEN CAN USE IT!!
DETACHABLE HOOD FOR WET SHAVE!!
RIGHT POCKET
LEFT POCKET
There is two ways to dispose the hair clippings after dry shaving or hair cut. The first is simply brushing the hair off the mat into the garbage can, the second is simply picking up the mat and shaking it over the garbage. The Clean cover can be washed in the same sink after using, you can literally ring the Clean Cover out like a wash rag and let dry it dries in less than five minutes . Makeup can be wiped clean with a damp cloth.
The Clean Cover is made of Ripstop Polyester which is perfect for loose hair or makeup particles to slide off with ease plus its tuff material that will last for years.
CLEAN COVER HAIR MAT FOR HER!!
              FINALLY A SOLUTION!!
MAKE GROOMING FUN AGAIN!!
WET SHAVE!!!
GREAT FOR TRAVEL!!!
GREAT FOR GIFTS!!
Approximately 30 million women experience hair lose every year, with nothing to help with the messy appearance that's left behind. The Clean Cover is the perfect solution to prevent strings of hair from clogging the drain.
A one hundred person survey was completed in January of 2014 with 3 basic questions: 1) When you cut, trim, shave or apply makeup over the bathroom sink, how do you prevent particles from going everywhere? A) Use the towel method  B) Use newspaper  C) Nothing, run it down the drain. 2) On a scale of 1-10, 10 being the highest how important is it to have a clean appearance in your bathroom and avoid arguments between husbands/wives, roommates/friends, brothers/sisters etc.? 3) Would you purchase a hair mat specifically designed to prevent this problem? The results were amazing and exactly what I was looking for! 60 out of 100 uses the towel method, 37 runs hair down the drain and 3 uses newspaper! 95 people out of 100 rated 10 on the importance of a clean bathroom and avoiding arguments!  98 people out of 100 said they would purchase a hair mat now! 95 people out of 100 rated 10 on the importance of a clean bathroom and avoiding arguments.
 (FACTS) Using a towel is one of the worst methods to use, because hair particles are sharp and can get caught in cloth causing a trail of hair everytime you use it or when washing. Have you ever washed a towel that was used for hair clippings? Its a nightmare, loose hair gets into everything involved, other clothes, all over the washer, as well as the clean water. Another horrible method is running hair down the drain, which can cause unnecessary plumbing cost due to clogging in the pipes.
MAKE LOOSE HAIR AND MAKEUP A THING OF THE PAST!
        STOP LIVING LIKE THIS!! CONSISTENTLY MAINTAIN A CLEAN AND ORGANIZED BATHROOM!!
Not only can you use the Clean Cover for head, face and makeup, but its great for shaving arms, underarms, nose, and chest as well.  
Home hair-cutting kits are expanded in the U.S. year over year! (Clipper sales rise as hairlines recede) "Wall Street Journal". More and More people are cutting their own hair to save money. Companies like Conair, Americas largest private company has made 2.23 billion dollars in revenue. Wahl clippers are sold in 165 countries world wide with also 154.6 million in revenue and Andis, a fairly new company just started in 2010 had already made 4.11 million. I give you those statistics to say if people are spending millions and millions of dollars on home hair-cutting kits, there is a high demand for a product to make it more convenient, fast, easy, and efficient to clean up after yourself. Hair clippers and a Clean Cover go hand and hand, meaning alot of money can be made.
The Clean Cover could even be pitched to one of the above companies as a package that includes a set of clippers and a Clean Cover Hair Mat.

What makes the clean cover so unique is that it can fit any style, shape or size sink as well as being universal both MEN and WOMEN can use it. The Clean Cover can also be personalized with team logo, picture, name or uplifting quote.

The market for this product is wide open. There is absolutely nothing like it. College kids would buy, moms for the men in the house, dads for the lady's in the house, roommates, friends, brothers, sisters. I see this product selling out during the holidays.

Over time the Clean Cover has improved and added features along the way! Here's were I started as well as the final complete project!

How To Use

Design: Scott Hansen
Published by S.P.Hansen Games
The four most powerful and respected members of the tribe, the Chief, Shaman, Hunter and Maiden, have come together, each seeking the favor of the Great Spirit. To win that favor, the four must each perform a ritual dance, with the best dance earning the desired favor.
Mahola (meaning dance) is a lively and engaging card game for 3 to 4 players themed around the beautiful dances of the Native American culture. A full game typically takes around 30 minutes to finish.
From the very first play test, Mahola has been a player favorite. Experienced professionals to casual players have all found the game fun, full of interaction and beautiful to look at. 
An early play test session at the Dallas Designer Group
Reviewers have great things to say about Mahola!
"Great little game. Amazing art. Unique refreshing theme." - The Bearded Meeple
"Mahola plays very smoothly, has gorgeous art, a unique theme done in a very respectful manner..." - Maurice Fitzgerald, Club Fantasci
        "Mahola is simple to learn, fun to play and has a nice tactical element to it." - John Haremza
"As I am part Native American I really appreciate Scott’s work on this game. I have had a great time playing this game." - Christopher Richter
"The unique theme, the fantastic artwork and the ease of play with decisions to be made each round make this one an easy choice to back..." - Brandon, WDYPTW Podcast
French Game Reviewer digs Mahola!
Mahola's Official Board Game Geek Page... stop by give Mahola a big thumbs up!
Are you in the DFW area? Come to the Mahola Game Play Demo at Roll2Play in Coppell on February 6th! Click for more info!
"I am proud that Mahola made the BGG list for Most Anticipated American West Games for 2016!"
                  "One of the many talented artisans at the 53rd Annual Indian Pow Wow in Grand Prairie, Texas"
You may be wondering where the customary stretch goals are. To be honest, there are none because the game is complete as it stands. You're getting high quality components and art from the get go.
I thought about adding the Wampum Beads as a stretch goal, but I thought that some might not like having real bone tokens. I decided that I'd let the backers decide for themselves if they wanted them for a minimal addition to the cost of the game. It's an interesting touch that I thought would add to the theme of the game.
I have just been given the option of making the cards in linen! It adds a little cost to the game but I ran some numbers and I can swing the upgrade if we to $2200 in pledges! Lets get there!
NEW! 
I have decided to reward all backers with a Kickstarter Only reward for supporting Mahola! Introducing the Tribal Elder. This will only be available to backers and never offered in the retail version of the game. 
Mahola was part of the DDG Showcase at Dallas Games Marathon's Nerd Night (click here to learn more about DGM!)
         The review by the Bearded Meeple has an excellent breakdown of the rules and how to play the game. Here are the rules if you want to check them out yourself.
The Playing Board Games Twitch show played a full game of Mahola and give their feedback during and afterwards. They loved it. Check out the video on their YouTube channel.
Here is a game play video I made to show the game 'in action'. I did this one solo, and add some strategies to help you make the best dance!
Feel free to ask any questions you may have!
Game Play Tip: Playing special dance cards with matching secondary dances beside one another scores BOTH!
 Mahola will retail at $20 in stores, but backers will get their game at a big discount as a huge 'thank you' for helping to make the game a reality! 
Some of the teepees on display at the 53rd Annual Indian Pow Wow in Grand Prairie, Texas.
Thank you for your interest, and I hope you will become a backer!
I am a proud member of the Dallas Designer Group. A big Thank You to the awesome members who put Mahola through its paces!
                                    Here's what some of the backers have been saying about my previous successfully funded game Posse: Wild West Justice:
- "Loving the game, and it's been a Christmas hit with the Family!"
- "Won my first game of Posse tonight. I really enjoyed. Looking forward to another go."
- "Enjoyed the mechanics, loved the theme."
- "This game is great!"
- "He really dug [Posse], he ended up staying an hour after his shift ended to play more games of it."
I've been a designer for over two decades, and after my family, I love designing games more than anything in this world! D Magazine took notice when my design, Luxor, passed 40 million downloads in its first year.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
First, let me get the standard disclaimer out of the way. 

There are always issues that can pop up which can never be accounted for or foreseen. I have minimized these by doing as much preparation as possible and having a good plan in place. I will always keep backers informed without spamming, and will be open to any and all questions about the game or the campaign.

My first campaign was Posse: Wild West Justice, which funded in September 2015, and was completely fulfilled December 2015... well in advance of the estimated March 2016. I built in time to account for the completion of the character art, and shipping of dice from China, etc. Almost everything planned for went well, and the game was ready early. 90% of the backers had the game in hand before Christmas.

Mahola is planned with the same attention to detail. The game is fully designed and tested, and has been getting kudos from all that have played it. Once funded, and the funds are transferred, production will be set into motion. No time is wasted getting you the game you pledged for!
