My name is Beth Ellen Nash. My passion has always been to help outside-the-box learners get Wings to Soar. Over the past 16 years working with struggling learners, I've researched and developed many ideas to help dyslexics. This Kickstarter includes publishing my Help and Hope for Dyslexics book and video course. It also includes publishing Wings to Soar Foundations: Integrated, Multisensory Language Arts with Words You Really Use which includes readers, handwriting, commonly confused words practice, card games, bingos, game boards, word cards, sentence templates, and practice online. I also want to expand the programs Wings to Soar Online Academy can include in our customized Dyslexia Intervention Packages. 
For those who would prefer a video overview of the elements included in this Kickstarter, I have provided this 2 1/2 minute video. Or peruse the images and text below.
PLAY

I have compiled my 16 years' experience working with dyslexics, including my own extensive research, into a set of informational resources. These include a 2 1/2 hour online self-paced course in Udemy and paperback and e-book versions of the same overview of dyslexic strengths and challenges, as well as options for accommodation and remediation. These resources are targeted to parents, teachers, and tutors who are trying to help dyslexics gain the confidence and skills needed to thrive in school and in life. 
This 5 minute video provides an overview of the material contained in the Help and Hope for Dyslexics book and 2 1/2 hour video course.
PLAY

Wings to Soar Online Academy currently serves 98 students with over 70% having learning challenges. This Kickstarter will allow us to expand our Dyslexia Intervention Packages. We will have even more quality programs that provided targeted remediation for weak dyslexic skills. These Dyslexia Intervention Packages come with coaching support and any of the resources from our Wings to Soar Foundations program (described below) that are appropriate, in addition to 3-5 online intervention programs with personalized learning paths in each to help dyslexic students gain the confidence and skills needed to succeed in school and in life.
Since shortly after taking my basic Orton-Gillingham class, back in 2000, I have been creating resources to help dyslexics and early readers. To engage my students, I came up with 75 multisensory ways to do the core reading and spelling practice needed. In addition, Dad and I created many board, card, and bingo games, word sorts, scavenger hunts, and readers. This helped to make the basic and fairly boring Orton-Gillingham practice more fun. 
I also wanted to make sure the words and spelling patterns I was having my students practice were actually useful words. So, my husband wrote me a computer program to analyze the dictionary, so I could figure out how many words actually use each phonetic pattern. I also have spent countless hours analyzing word frequency lists to make sure the words I'm including in my materials are "words you really use." Out of this, I have developed Wings to Soar Integrated, Multisensory Language Arts with Words You Really Use. 
For this Kickstarter, I want to get all of the resources Dad and I already have in various stages of development for the Foundations level into a marketable product suite. We have handwriting practice pages, readers, word cards, game boards, bingos, and commonly confused words practice worksheets created. Preliminary lists for the next two levels are in use by some of our students in Vocabulary and Spelling City. I also want to expand the already fairly extensive set of resources we have created for the Kindergarten level. 
You can well imagine that there are many costs associated with a project of this scope. Here's my budget breakdown:
Our blog and social media pages help to disseminate current information available about helping dyslexics. You can help this Kickstarter and stay informed with what I am finding about dyslexia by liking Wings to Soar Online Academy on Facebook, joining my LinkedIn network, and following Beth Ellen Nash on Twitter and Pinterest. If you like what you see, please like, comment, and share it as it will help spread the word.
Please support our Kickstarter to help provide Help and Hope for Dyslexics and their families. I look forward to getting to know you on our social media pages. And if you choose to take advantage of one of the Dyslexia Intervention Packages, I will be your Intervention Specialist supporting you.

campaign.story:
This FUN NEW KID'S TV SHOW is filled with excitement and adventure. When a regular teacher finds a group of bears, who could talk and walk, she tries to uncover their magical secret!
Our children's imagination is key to many areas of fundamental and sound growth during the formative periods of development. That is why I have created and designed a show that will not only capture all of the child's attention and hold it, but hold it with creative, exciting, and colorful adventure, while educating at the same time. TV has proven that it indeed can be a good tool for the aiding of teaching positive and lasting characteristic straits needed for the adult life. 
Additionally, we have seen in many cultures, a confirmed evidence that what continually surrounds a child during those crucial and important growing years has a profound impact on 'what' that adult carries into many areas of his/her's life.
Thus, was, and continues to be my desire to be a part of shaping the heart, mind, and character of tomorrow's child. If you see what I am seeing in today's youth, there is a crying in your spirit for the decline of innocence, simple manners, poor language, education, and respect for family and self. Join with me in being a part of a solution. Please support Korry' Bears Storz Lane.
Every week, (repetition) the show will release a new episode that will teach children about integrity, self-worth, responsibility, accountability, honor and respect. Plus, it'll all feel like fun to them.
MY STORY
Why did I choose to do a show for children for my very first TV pilot? Most importantly; children are our future, and I don't know about many of you, but when I look around, and what's before me in youth, I grow increasing worry of what the future may present if there isn't a change, and I mean a drastic change in parenting. Have you ever wondered why the percentage of home-schooling have gone up? These parents do not want their child/children in "public" schools. If some are like me, they are witness to: 
our young boys with pants hanging down their butts exposing their underwear
the most foul language that turn a sailor face two-shades red
disrespect on all levels
disregard of authority
low to no self-respect
girls half-naked and exposing breast and butt checks
twerking
under-age sex
drug use in elementary school
.....and the list goes on.
I've decided to be among many who desire a change,and not  simply 'sit' and hope for a change, but MAKE a change to the best of my God-given ability. 
WHERE DO WE PARENTS, GRANDPARENTS, and GUARDIANS begin?  At home at an early, early age. And many culturals, and in many homes, the TV is the babysitter. Moms are busy cleaning hourse, and all the other things today's mom are challenged with while caring for the babies. So, where do they put the child? In front of the TV. Yes, there are many, many, many children programming today that entertain the child for hours on end. But are these show entirely focused on family structure and principles build upon the WORD of God? Not that I'm aware of. Do you know of any?
What I've done (oh, by-the-way, I taught Sunday School for over twenty years to primary and elementary school children - loved it!) is take scriptures that approach challenges that today's child is facing. For episode one, David and Goliath, is the story. Why? Because around the nation, 'bullying' is destroying our future children. 
How and What is Korry's Bears Storz Lane about and What Exactly is the Solution to the Above in the Show?
Korry Miller is a elementary teacher who is growing frustrated and close to the point of desperation, in her difficulty capturing and holding the attention of her disruptive second and third grade students. My goodness, the little tots are pretty much running the class. 
Wary and eager to get on with vacation plans, she has no idea that this vacation will be like none other she's ever experinced. HELP IS ON THE WAY IN A VERY STRANGE WAY. In Virginia's  Shenandoah Valley, Korry stumbles upon a group of five bears. But there's something strange about these bears. They are walking and talking just like her!
Strangely, instead of being afraid, Korry feels attracted..somehow connected to the bears, after they greet her in perfect English. It isn't long before she invites them inside her cabin, and feeds and clothes them. Then, not long there after that she gives them names to match their individual characteristics. BUT, nothing could prepare her for what comes next. Korry soon finds out a the magical secret to their arrival on her property! 
Meet the Bears!
Kayleb is the oldest female bear, and has a goal to be a teacher. 
Omar is a happy toddler bear, but is a tad mischievous.  
Rebekah is the teen bear who likes to have fun without restrictions. 
Raven is one of the smartest of the  cubs.       
Yancey is the oldest and wisest bear. He is the TIME TRAVELER
 FOR THE CHILDREN'S DELIGHT, THERE'S IS THE MYSTICAL DOOR AND TWINKLING LIGHTS OF THE TIME TRAVELING TUNNEL SLIDE.
Yancey, the oldest bear holds the key to not only helping his new friend, Korry Miller, regain control of her classroom, but to a MAGIC DOOR leading to an entrance toa mystical TUNNEL SLIDE, which the children from the "live" audiance will, at the end of each story, enter through the Magic Door, slide down the twinkling TUNNEL SLIDE , and experience the ancient Bible story  at the end of the slide. How awesome and educational is that!   Yancey and his friends are going to teach the teacher how to teach. The secret is to keep it interesting enough to hold them captivated. Yipeeee.
Episode Descriptions
Every episode will open with the electrifying theme song Korry’s Bear. 
Each of the bears (cute costumed actors) will danced their own (professionally chorographed) dance groove at their announced name. Then, as a backdrop, there will be the animated bears to make it even the more entertaining for the children.
Episode One - Korry meets the bears: After the intro, Korry will pick from the studio audience two children to sit with her: .Korry will read that day’s Bible story.  Yancy will soon discover his mystical magical powers, and  he also discovers that he’s returned with the power to build a Magical Door to take others with him to experience the awesome and inspirational, educational, and character-building stories of the scripture.
After each story, and at every episode closing, the bears and children are lead by Yancey back in time to live in and through the period of that narrative. Along with the costumed actors protraying desinated roles, there will be the animated ‘extra’ cast in the foreground.
Core curriculum Goal: Facing  the Bully
David and Goliath
Show Objective(s): The children will re-tell the story of David and Goliath- discuss that we must trust in God to help us.
The story appeals to nearly everyone …especially children because no matter how big they grow, they may find themselves in situations where they are in a vulnerable position and someone else is in the power position—whether facing a bully on the playground, or a parent,—we all know what it’s like to feel intimidated. When the children listen to the story, they can put themselves in David’s shoes—or sandals—and vicariously experience victory of the weak over the strong.Before going through the Magic Door, there’s Q & A time:
•Who was bigger, David or Goliath?
•How many stones did David use to kill Goliath?
•Why did David get angry with the giant?
Show 2
Noah’s Ark - Noah Obeys God
 Show Objective(s): Noah, Animals, obedience Children will understand that it is important for us to obey God.
BIBLE VERSE: Noah walked with God
Omar, the toddler bear is excited about the story of Noah and the Ark because Noah took bears of the big boat! Korry is having a bit of trouble reading the story because keeping him in his seat and quiet is a task because he wants to tell the story. It’s his favorite. Finally, she is able to explain to the children that Noah loved and obeyed God even when no one else would. Then, at last Omar gets his chance to shine. With Yancey’s help, he heads the Q & A.
Discussion Questions & Answers:
In our story today who was following God? (Noah.)
What did God tell Noah to build? (An Ark.)
What is an Ark? (A boat that was very big.)
Why did God tell Noah to build the Ark? (God was going to cause a flood of water to cover the earth.)
Core curriculum Goal: Building Character
Daniel and the Lion’s Den
Show Objective(s): Children will learn: Godly character allows others to see Jesus more clearly. Character has consequences. Godly character requires discipline.
Korry reads Daniel 6 to the bears and studio guest, and teaches that all are to live such good lives among the pagans that, though they accuse you of doing wrong, they may see your good deeds and glorify God on the day He visits them.In a fun way, and so that young children can understand, she teaches that God is always faithful to answer prayer for specific needs of bear and child.Yancy will aid with reciting the memory verse together. Then he will explain pagans (unbelievers, people not following Christ). At Q & A, Rebekah will ask: What is character? Allow the bears and children to respond. (A person, esp. with reference to behavior or personality)
What are some character traits that people can have? (Honest, liar, lazy, hard worker, encourager, discourager, loyal, disloyal, etc.)
Character traits can be positive and they can be negative.
Character also has consequences. If you are honest, people will trust you. If you are lazy, you won’t get good grades that come from studying. Godly character requires discipline. We must follow God every day and obey His commands to have Godly character.
Then Yancey explains as bears and audience guest are lining up to go through the magic door.
THE KEY PRODUCTION TEAM
Tim Wilson, Filmmaker
Ted Geiger, Executive Director

Tim Wilson came 'highly' recommended as a filmmaker, and was formally introduced to me about ten years ago. I had just completed my first big stage production,Nefertiti 18th Dynasty,and he filmed the EPK kit. The results of his work superceded anything I could have imagined or hoped for. It was superb, excellent, professional, and the quality of color was breathtaking. Needless to say, he and I are working together to acheive the same results in Korry's Bears Storz Lane. 
Take a look at his impressive credentials:  Tim is currently part owner of a film production company titled  RvI Motion Media, located in Temple Hills, Maryland. Tim is currently part owner of a film production company titled RVI Media. He is also known for reshaping the quality of Nollywood USA Films. One of his notable Nollywood films, Paparazzi: Eye in the Dark, made a historical theatrical run in the United States in 2011 where he served as a cinematographer and editor. 
Additionally, Tim has directed, filmed, and edited productions for clients such as: Blackground Records, Tommy Boy Entertainment and TVT Records; As well as EPK's for national artists and book authors such as: "Naughty by Nature", Tank (American singer), Kimberly Scott (singer), and Motivational Speaker, Valorie Burton. Tim has also received several awards and film festival nominations for his work on the short Sci-Fi film, Apple Crumb Panic.
He considers Nollywood to be the new black Hollywood. More recently in 2013, the award-winning Nollywood feature, One Night In Vegas, in which Tim was cinematographer and editor, has been gaining world-wide media buzz and various publications via sources such as: CCTV, Voice of America, The Washington Post, and WUSA-9. 
TED A. GEIGER
Ted Geiger is a veteran Technical Director in the Entertainment Industry, and a seasoned entrepreneur for manufacturing startups. 
During Ted's  tenure at the Coral Springs Center for the Arts, the City was awarded the Governors Sterling Award which was the ground breaking work that led to the City of Coral Springs becoming the first city in the nation to receive a sanctioned Malcolm Balridge Award - for Total Quality Management (TQM). Ted started with partners and sold the firm after 2 years of operations to a group in Ft Lauderdale, Florida – a process he has completed several times across varied industries, i.e. a HOMEVESTORS Franchise, World Properties, Inc., Nova Technologies, Inc.
        Highlights of Qualifications to lead the Korry Team
Ted has six years theatre consulting –new construction, and renovations. Twenty years’ experience in technical production and production manage-ment, including theatre, trade shows, conventions, live TV. music videos, and large circus acts. Professional talent for all phases of construction industry disciplines, and facility maintenance. 
Ted comes to Korry's Bears Storz Lane with a wealth of experience in 'all' the areas of expertise of making a TV show successful, and I am ever so grateful that he has agreed to be a part of this show.

Carol Green, Self-Employed Storyteller, Solo Performer, Actor, Writer, and Teacher 1999 - Present. She has performed at colleges, churches, and community theatres in the Baltimore, DC, and VA area. She regularly serves as speaker and lecturer in religious settings, colleges, libraries, museums, and community centers. 
Carol is superbly perfect for the role of Korry.  As Senior Pastor of the Wilson Boulevard Christian Church, Arlington, VA.since 2006, she is well familiar with the stories from the Bible, and will bring the stories to life without rehearsing them.  Provide pastoral leadership. Preach and teach weekly in the local church setting.
Further, her expertise in serving as lecturer and conference preacher in WEAA-FM Baltimore 1981-1985, Radio News Announcer for evening drive time WJZ-TV Baltimore 1985-1990, and News room Assistant/writer for evening news and feature story segments, will bring the presence of TV professionalism, a new show needs .

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Making a spanking-brand new TV-Pilot is hard. And add the two-fold task of making a children's TV Pilot with a biblical theme...therein becomes the ultimate crusade.

A thorough knowledge of the television industry is crucial to anyone working effectively in the area. The TV industry's vertical addition can make entry as a new-comer difficult. Recent mergers and exclusive agreements between program producers and networks have made it extremely difficult for independent producers such as myself to find distribution.

Sudden and unpredictable personnel changes in the television industry can make it difficult to broker relationships facilitating program production and sponsorship, especially for independent producers.

Again, projects such as Korry's Bears relying for their success on financial participation by outside organizations are at considerable risk, if this participation isn't locked in before proceeding. [this is why we really need Kickstarter]

Production work and programming in the television industry generally occur up to 18 months before the television season. [Korry's Bears Storz Lane will debut on a and new community cable station looking for 'fresh' new programs for children, and our show is in the line-up.

Support for the concept of educational programming that includes support that would affect a network's bottom line. More is known about the negative effects of TV than the positive ones. 

 SOLUTION: Korry's Bears!

Variation: A “safe second” means the pilot’s bosses have been discreetly all-but-assured that the actor will be available. We don't have to worrry about satisfying big stations with BIG NAME actors. We're using BEARS.

campaign.story:
My kids LOVE popsicles!  They're cool and refreshing on a hot summer day, but they always seem to melt in their hands, not in their mouths, making for a sticky, napkin-soaked mess.  
One day it hit me!  Instead of screaming and getting mad at the kids every time the Popsicle dribble on their shirt, why don't I invent something to contain that sticky mess.  Egad, brilliant!  I suspect my yelling will be reduced by at least 35% (Okay.. okay... I'm joking.  I don't yell at the kids... that much, and neither should you).
Tired of sticky hands and juice-stained clothes?  Eliminate the mess with a PopZgrip!
PopZgrips are made with non toxic, lead-free, PVC-free, BPA-free, phthalate-free FDA approved food grade durable plastic material. They are dishwasher safe and freezer safe. 
On those hot summer days, just slide an icy cold popsicle into the PopZgrip slot and let the kids enjoy a refreshing treat without the worry of ending up with a sticky mess.
Design sketches...  Where it all began
CAD model... A method to our madness
Prototype created...  The proof is in the pudding (or popsicle)
Timeline/Schedule
So when am I going to get my cool PopZgrip?
Funding/Budget
Now that we're confident in our design, we've decided to start the first round of production.  We're trying to raise our goal of $25,000 to help pay for the molding tool, patent fees, initial minimum production size and packaging.  Being a small business, we need your support and we thank you!
Our budget breaks down our costs, so you know exactly where you money is being invested.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Design validation:

While the design is considered to be complete, we are still in the process of validating and eating to ensure it meets our design requirements. After the brutal testing phase of eating countless popsicles and suffering dozens of brain freezes, we feel that the design can be considered mostly complete. There are a few boxes of popsicles left though, so we think we'll actually give them to the kids this time and see how they do.
 
Based on this exhaustive testing, at this time we do not see any areas of risk in the design. The prototypes have resulted in some small design improvements which will be integrated into the final design.

Injection molding complication:

While we have over 20 years of plastic design experience, injection molding a part for the first time can results in some unforeseen issues. Typically, these will require minor design changes to improve the parts moldability. Again, we do not foresee any issues with the part as designed, but will not know for sure until we receive first articles off the mold tool and eat our first few hundred popsicles. 

Shipping:

Neither rain nor snow, sleet or hail, oxen or house drawn cart, some things are just out of our control. Hopefully they don't fall off, get lost or float away. That's okay, between the 4wd Jeep, sailboat and the jet ski, I think we can track them down : )

campaign.story:
Thank you so much, everyone, for supporting Project Dreamscape! The last 30 days have been incredible, and we couldn't have done it without you!
Dr. Reed is the foremost pioneer in connecting the human mind to digital systems. It was his intention to see if people could work together while dreaming, but what he discovered was an untapped source of creativity that brings dreams to life. It doesn’t matter what age, gender, or race a person is--they have the potential for unimaginable ingenuity. Now you too can live your dreams by participating in Project Dreamscape.
Your turn starts by choosing whether or not to take a facedown card, called a Z card--these Z cards are currency in the game, but also count against you when it comes time to tally up the scores. Z cards are used to purchase cards from the Dreamscape, which are then placed in your REM stack. You must choose one of the two abilities on a card to activate when you collect it, but the real fun of the game comes from chaining these abilities together.
Any one of the eight dream abilities in Project Dreamscape, by itself, produces only a minor effect--take a card, flip a card, rearrange some cards, and so on. But with some clever card play, one dream ability can lead to another until you've collected several cards or even cleared the entire Dreamscape. This continues until there are not enough cards to fully refill the Dreamscape after a player’s turn. At that point, the game is over and it's time to score.
Scoring is simple. Just lay out your faceup cards in the order they were stacked, and then find matching abilities that appear on adjacent cards (the orientation of the cards does not affect scoring, but you may wish to rotate the cards to find these chains). Wherever two or more copies of an ability are next to one another, you score points as shown on the score chart. After scoring all of your chains, subtract points equal to the amount of Z cards you have, and that’s your final score.
For some examples of Project Dreamscape's chaining mechanics, check out Richard Ham's wonderful run-through:
Check out the full rules for more information, and the free print-and-play files on BoardGameGeek:
Project Dreamscape: Rules
Project Dreamscape: Print-and-Play files
Project Dreamscape also has a single player variant, although it's currently only available digitally; however, we hope to include the rules in the box over the span of the campaign! You can find the rules for Virtual Dreaming on BoardGameGeek:
Project Dreamscape: Virtual Dreaming
Inside Project Dreamscape, you'll find a sleep deck of 52 cards, two reference cards, five Z shield tokens, a full-color rulebook, a special active player marker, and an expansion deck consisting of 54 cards (three alternate dream types!). The game will come packaged in a sturdy two-piece box that measures approximately 3.5x5.5"--about twice the width of a deck of cards, and still very pocket-sized!
"Small, portable, and challenging, Project Dreamscape engaged each of our players and kept them hooked. Each game provided new insight on new ways to manipulate and organize the Dream cards, mess with opponents, and create killer combos. Project Dreamscape is a game you can learn how to play in 5 minutes and take all afternoon to work out the many different ways to win. Now that’s a good game."
Cyrus Kirby, Father Geek (full preview)
  "It took a couple turns to understand some of the combos and nuances, and then we were off and running! Terrific, clever game!"
Chris Leder, Game Designer, Roll for It!
  "The peaceful artistic style of Project Dreamscape guides you through a quick, combo-making dream you'll want to have over and over again."
Brian Henk, Overworld Games, Designer of Good Cop Bad Cop
  "It's a fun game that I think will only get better with more plays."
Jason Glover, Greygnome Games
  "Deceptively cute, PD is a light, yet deeply strategic card game that keeps you on your toes until the very end."

Kell Brigan, play-tester
 
"Project Dreamscape might put on a cute, simple facade, but there is deep strategy to be found in this dream world. The ability to rearrange the dreamscape and play powers off of other players' cards is a fresh and ever-changing way to formulate your strategy. Just don't plan too far in advance, because other players' sinister arrangements can plunge your perfect plan into deep sleep!"
John Shulters, play-tester

A word from Ben Haskett...
Sarah and Will organize a game designers meeting each month, where local designers can get together and play test each other's games. I was first invited to attend the meet-up about two years ago (where we became good friends), and it was at one of these meetings that I first played Project Dreamscape.
I remember the first couple of turns very well, as I struggled a little bit to find my footing. I understood the basics; you use facedown cards to buy faceup cards, you play one of the two options on each card, you chain them together... but on my third or fourth turn, the game just clicked for me. I realized that these eight dream types, while perhaps a bit mild when played alone, could be combined for a very satisfying "never-ending turn" effect found in games like Dominion. By the end of the first game, I knew we had to take Project Dreamscape to the next level.
Will and Sarah Reed
The two of them already had an artist in mind, Julie Okahara, who created some beautiful watercolor art for the game.  Playful and dreamy, with just a hint of uneasiness, her paintings were a perfect fit for the game's tone.  Her work typically utilizes mixed media, which is in full effect here--if you look closely at the card art, you can see that sections are cut out to reveal all sorts of glittered and textured papers.
The design goal with Project Dreamscape was to create a big experience in a small package--not a micro game, mind you, but simply a small game that packed a lot of compelling decisions into a 30-minutes experience.  The mechanics came first, and the theme was later integrated as Will lay awake at night tying to pair something with the game; when you're asking yourself, "What do people want the most?" late at night, I suppose it's easy to understand why Will settled on sleep as an appropriate theme.
For more insight into Sarah and Will's design process, check out their designer blog posts on Project Dreamscape:
How I Designed Project Dreamscape

The Finished Look
All of Project Dreamscape's artwork was hand-painted by the talented Julie Okahara. For more information about her wonderful art, check out her website at www.julieokahara.com.
To get a closer look at the artwork that Julie painted, check out our gallery on BoardGameGeek.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be the second Kickstarter campaign I’ve run. While my first campaign was very successful, there was still a lot to learn from the experience that I will be able to apply directly to Project Dreamscape. There may be unforeseen circumstances (my first campaign is a testament to them!), but I pride myself on being open and honest about every step of the process; even if it’s bad news, I’ll make sure you’re aware.

I have two personal goals with this campaign, and the first is to deliver on time. Having been through the process now, I feel like I have a better understanding of where delays might occur, and I've taken measures to solve those issues beforehand. Further, Project Dreamscape has the benefit of being a small card game. This will greatly reduce the amount of time required by the manufacturer to produce a proof copy, and mitigate the chance for issues--in other words, Project Dreamscape will be able to begin production very soon after the close of the campaign.

My second goal is to make shipping easier for international backers--there was some behind-the-scenes confusion in my first campaign concerning how EU shipments were to be handled. Project Dreamscape will ship out to backers from the US, but to touch on the game's size once more, it's small enough that one copy of the game will easily ship from the US in a small package and almost certainly not get held for additional customs/broker fees.

updates.update_userinfo: The Games Are Now With Ship Naked!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, dreamers! I received word yesterday that Project Dreamscape has reached Ship Naked--the fulfillment company that will be shipping you your rewards*.
*If you pledged for a collector's edition or your pledge included original artwork, I'll be shipping your rewards myself. And of course, if you're coming to the local pick up, you'll be picking up your reward yourself. :)
You may be saying, out loud to your monitor, "Hey, didn't you miss a step? I thought the games had to go through customs." You're right, but they passed through customs so quickly that I didn't even have time to let you know before they reached Ship Naked. Granted, it took a week to FedEx the games across the country, but last Friday (October 9), my wife and I welcomed our second daughter into the world. It was a whirlwind of a labor this time, starting at 4:15 a.m. and finishing up just three hours later--and little Olivia Grace Haskett was born at a whopping 10.2 pounds! We're all back at home now, sleeping whenever possible, but mostly just staring at a little baby.

updates.update_userinfo: The Games Have Reached U.S. Shores!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, dreamers!  On Friday, October 2, the boat carrying Project Dreamscape reached US shores.  Now we wait for the games to pass through customs and drive to New Hampshire, where they’ll be shipped out to all of you--we’re in the home stretch!  Everything is ready to go--the mats and special edition boxes are all paid for and are in production (Lyris Laser and the company responsible for the mouse pads are both running at full capacity but will be finishing up soon).
Looking at the calendar, an October delivery will be very tight, but still likely.  Worst case scenario, games will start showing up in early November--but I would of course be thrilled to hit my targeted release date.  The local pick-up is still planned, but a firm date won’t be possible until I know when the games will arrive--for those of you attending, please stay tuned!  If it turns out, after a date is set, that some of you can’t make it, I’ll either send it myself or, if practical, hand-deliver it to you.  :)
I want to thank all of you for filling out the survey I sent out recently. As of this writing, only 10 of you have yet to complete it, so I will have to come after you shortly.

SLIK Lubricant VS Muddy Water and Sand Test. How well does SLIK handle wet sand directly poured onto it? http://bit.ly/1AvYYub
WE DID IT! OUR INITIAL GOAL HAS BEEN REACHED!
NOW FOR SOME STRETCH GOALS!
Harnessing the power of nature and science, I was able to create what I think are three amazing products that are 100% non-toxic and all natural. So for all those who prefer to live a greener life style, this fits well into that category. Not only are they extremely effective but they beat out well known brands that they were tested against.
SLIK Travel Kit
     I personally find this to be pretty hilarious, but the idea first came to me in my sleep. I woke up at around 2am one morning and thought to myself “I can make my own lube!”. I don’t remember what I was dreaming to prompt this idea and I probably don’t want to know but none the less, the idea was stuck in my mind. The lubricant I had in mind was originally for machine parts, door hinges, chains etc. Starting a conversation with my friends about this idea elicited all kind of jokes and laughter to say the least.
I started my quest to create the ultimate lubricant using the little bit of knowledge I had about the different properties of various ingredients as well as their viscosity.After months of research and testing, I was able to create a lubricant that was not only waterproof, but surpassed the effectiveness of well-known brand names.
SLIK had to outperform what was already on the market otherwise, what’s the point right?
SLIK has been tested in dry, hot, and cold environments; even in the humid and salty air of the island of Guam.
Had to be water-resistant (Tests have shown that SLIK is waterproof for many weeks if not longer)  
Able to withstand the temperature changes of different environments and still be effective (passed with flying colors)    
Had to be rust resistant (Prevents rust from forming effectively)
Any and all moving metal part
Bicycle Chains
Machinery
Waterproofing and preserving metal and wood
Waterproof and lubricating machinery on boats
Gun parts/slides
Knife conditioner/rust preventative
In the kitchen (Cleaning up grease and oil build up)
Brake dust cleaner
Permanent marker remover
So much more!
The initial testing consisted of applying the lubricant to high carbon steel which is highly prone to rusting and then submerging it in water. A week goes by, no rust. I take the piece of metal out to ensure that there is still lubrication on it and to my surprise, not only was the metal coated and protected, but it was still very oily. I then put the high carbon steel back into the water.Another week goes by, still no rust.
I then decide to test the lubricant in salt water and it was able to withstand it for a couple of days before starting to rust so I went back to the drawing board. After a bit of tweaking, I created a new formula and ran the salt water test once again. After a two week trial, there were no signs of rust.
Using the same test criteria with other known brands, rust started to form within 20 minutes to a couple of hours while SLIK remained un-phased.
BEFORE:
 AFTER:
     As you can see, the lubricant worked very well. In fact, it was so effective that I could not take it off using simple soap and water. I then created a natural solvent to remove the lubricant
The solvent is natural and in the form of a gel. The advantage of this “gel form” is that it sticks to what it’s applied to and does not run off.
Using the same dirty cotton swab, I decided to apply it on the foggy headlights of a car and wipe clean with a paper towel. It was as if I was using an eraser to clean them. No effort, it just worked.
BEFORE: (Lighting was not very good as the sun was going down but you can see a clear difference in the after picture)
AFTER:
The CLP is a combination of the lubricant and solvent put together. It works very well as an overall cleaner, lubricant, and preservative. It easily removes dirt, grime, carbon, and rust.
To start off, you the contributor will be able to enjoy SLIK and the many uses it can be applied to.
Small businesses: I have sourced all of the material here in the USA so every contribution is supporting not only this project but the many small businesses out there.

Kickstarter campaign completion. Supplies are ordered from already chosen small businesses in the US.
Start the production of SLIK lubricant, solvent, and CLP
April 2015:
Package and ship out SLIK rewards to all contributors
Any possible delays will be communicated immediately

BAKED ZITI is a mob comedy about two low-level wiseguys, Sal and Pauly, who get orders to whack their boss’ rivals or get whacked themselves. But they’re thieves, not killers, desperate for a way to do the job and still survive. At Sonny's restaurant, they learn that a surprise death befalls any customer who sits with a guy named Louie — the joint’s best patron — when Louie eats baked ziti. But can Sal and Pauly pull off a miracle and bring everything together so the rivals die and they live?
Friends and family have been asking to see our work on the screen. We’ve gotten incredible feedback on BAKED ZITI, especially from members of We Make Movies in Hollywood—a terrific community of filmmakers and actors—who participated in table reads of the script and encouraged us to move forward. So, this is a chance to support our writing and acting, and enjoy the talents of our amazing cast and crew. We hope you’ll donate to help us make BAKED ZITI, a fun mob comedy, come to life.
Also, we wrote a killer monologue that you'll only see if we get to make the movie.

Ready to help out a True American dream? It all started when I joined the U.S. Marines to serve my country. Now there is something that seems to be common across all branches....Tattoos. They are somewhat of a must in the military and now are very main stream in today's society. This part is no big secret. The one thing that eluded me when I wanted to get my first Marine Corps tattoo was where to get it, how much is a good price, how do I know this is a reputable artist? This business has seemed to be a mystery for some time. I found that even the artists themselves find it very difficult to connect with a client base efficiently. So after some years of research and planning, Ink Badger was born. Ink Badger is patent pending software that allows clients who are looking for tattoos to upload a design and have multiple artists bid in your local area. Each artist has their own profile page and is rated by prior clients. Once an artist wins the bid, the client goes for the consult with their set price and the confidence they are getting a great price from the right tattoo artist. This also solves the problem of up and coming artist looking to break in the business to find that customer that would never be able to find them. Ink Badger will also have an app that customers can upload a tattoo they currently have for a cover up bid. All the technology is in place to get my dream off the ground. Now we just need you to help us launch!!
We need your help for the launch phase and the funding will be specifically used for exhibition setup for conventions throughout the US starting in Florida. The equipment needed for the setup (monitors, sound, tables, giveaways, signs, etc) will cost what we are trying to raise.Travel of course will cost extra but getting the equipment is most important. Thank you for taking the time to read about my dream , and pledge as much as possible.

After serving 7 years in the military, it's been a long standing dream of mine to start my own farm with my family. There are a lot of Hop Farms in the lower and middle Wisconsin area, but none up in northern Wisconsin. $50,000 will hardly cover the costs for a 5 acre hop farm, but it will be enough to give us a good start. Our plan is to use 5 acres of farmland that the family owns in Florence Wisconsin, but what we need is funding for rhizomes, cables, poles and irrigation for the hop yard. I'm educated in the process of growing, maintaining and harvesting hops. Farming hops is a tedious process, and takes up to 2 years for the plant to fully mature. northern Wisconsin contains some of the richest soil in the country, which will give the hops a unique flavor and aroma. campaign.story:
If you want to support Ring Veteran and can't back here on Kickstarter, you can back on ringveteran.com via PayPal. You'll receive the same rewards as Kickstarter backers, including Stretch Goals.
Is this game similar to WWE Supercard?
Not at all.
The in-the-ring game-play of Ring Veteran is best explained as a simulation of a real wrestling match that uses trading cards to portray the Superstars you use and the actions or Moves they perform. Here's an example of a real possible scenario in a wrestling match of Ring Veteran:
It's your opponents turn, and he plays a Punch. What will you do? 
Your options will depend on what cards you have in your Hand that can counter his move, if any. Will you Duck? Will you grab his arm and put him in an Armbar? Or will you take the hit to conserve your counters and be better prepared for a powerful Finisher your opponent may later play that can also be countered by a Duck or an Armbar?
This of course, is among the simplest of possible scenarios. With hundreds of different Moves and Specials you can collect to use in your deck, there are thousands of different possible strategies and ways you can use them. You will find Ring Veteran to be satisfyingly abundant with room for creativity and personalized strategy.
Will Ring Veteran be available on Mobile devices?
Yes! Upon release, Ring Veteran will be available on Windows, Mac, Linux and all Android and iOS devices. Check out our updates for a quick Mobile demo.
SynamicD was founded by Pedro "Stone" Costa. Stone is the founder of SD Solutions, a web development company that has been in business since 2004. After years of developing websites and business management solutions, Stone set out to follow his true passion and dove into the world of game development.
This project was inspired by With Authority!, a game that was shut down over a decade ago but will forever be cherished by its players. The SynamicD team created a simple game with a captivating concept that developed a small but very loyal player base. With the encouragement and support of this amazing community we engaged in transforming the once simple game into an elaborate mainstream masterpiece.
For the past 2 years, the SynamicD team has worked tirelessly on transforming this great vision into a reality. Although being short-staffed and having scarce funding, we have successfully developed all of the core functions and many awesome features, and are set to launch the first Alpha on February 14th.
We have already completed about 80% of the game's development. All of our core servers, security, and backup systems are already 100% complete. Stone put everything on the line and made this project his full time job. Sharing his passion and vision, our team members have sacrificed their leisure time, neglected their day jobs and invested countless sleepless nights into getting the project this far. Now we need your help to complete it! 
There isn't much left to do in comparison to what's already done. Here's a breakdown of what you will be funding:
VIP System
Live Market
Achievements
Crafting System
Game animations
Automated events
Interactive Tutorial
Player card customization
Fix remaining bugs in the game
Finish detailing the Onyx Arena
Better servers to handle a large amount of players
Art for Moves and Specials (we have a fantastic artist, but the man needs to get paid!)
More info on some of the features mentioned above can be found in different sections of the full game description below.
We will post periodic updates with game play and feature videos as often as possible, so keep checking back!
We want to keep you updated on everything that's going on behind the scenes, so we created a YouTube channel, Synamic Fix, where we'll post periodic videos with news, updates, teasers, and more. We'll be eager to see your feedback.
Thanks to our partners Chair Shot Reality, the Synamic Fix channel also allows us to connect our community to some of greatest names in wrestling. Click on the image below to check out this exclusive SynamicD interview with Kevin Nash.
Stone interviews Kevin Nash
Check out the Synamic Fix channel for more development updates and detailed information on Ring Veteran.
Ring Veteran is developed in Unity 3D, which ultimately allows it to be completely cross-platform. Upon release, Ring Veteran will be available on Windows, Mac, Linux and on all Android and iOS devices.
Ring Veteran is a wrestling game like no other. By combining the turn based format of a Trading Card Game (TCG) with features of a Massive Online Multiplayer (MMO) and every key element of a wrestling match, Ring Veteran produces the most competitive wrestling game in the world.
You can create decks that consist of 1 Superstar and a combination of Momentum, Moves, and Specials. These decks can then be used inside the ring in competitive wrestling matches against opponents.
Ring Veteran is free to play. Upon registration, every user is given 4 Rookie Superstars, a starting collection, and 4 prebuilt decks. The Rookie collection is meant to help new players get comfortable with the game, and can be used to compete in Ring Veteran for game currency and prizes, but cannot be traded.
When you log in to Ring Veteran, you are placed in a fully interactive 3D world where everyone is represented by a player card. You can walk around and get to know the Onyx Arena. With your help, we want to allow you to see and interact with other players around the arena and participate in mini events for in-game prizes.
The list of things you can do while exploring the arena consists of but isn't limited to:
Interact with other players
Challenge other players into a match
Take on a Ring Veteran AI
Spectate other ongoing matches
Watch replays from big event matches (such as title matches)
Create or edit a deck
Participate in automated events such as Tournaments and Trivia
Level up your cards
Assign abilities to your superstars
Combine your cards to create a FOIL (shiny gold plated version)
Gamble your scrap cards for a chance to get better cards
Collect points and rewards by completing Achievements
Open your boosters packs.
Buy or Sell cards using our in-game currency in the Live Market
Purchase Superstars, boosters and more in our game store
Fully customize your player card
Our goal is to make Ring Veteran the type of game where you'll never run out activities. With an organized release schedule, we'll ensure that you're constantly seeing new card sets, features, and events.
  You can expect to see our stretch goals very shortly. Down in the Features List we will separate the features that are part of a stretch goal so that you are aware of what to expect prior to backing this project.
We want your player card to be a personalized representation of you. You will have the ability to fully customize your avatar, backgrounds, and borders. There will be new player customization items with every set that we release.
Though some of you may choose to be lone wolves in the Ring Veteran world, others prefer the company of others and will stick together to represent their Stables.
Stables are groups of friends who play Ring Veteran together for the added thrill of competing in Stable events, and completing achievements as a group. Stable specific events will happen periodically.
Now that we've covered so much of what happens outside of matches, let's get into the basics of a match in Ring Veteran.
In a match, your Superstar can perform a vast majority of wrestling maneuvers that are represented by Moves. Different Moves require different types and amounts of Momentum to play. Each Superstar has its own limits and strengths. This breakdown provides you with a realistic, dynamic, and competitive simulation of a wrestling match.
Ring Veteran Superstars are inspired by some of the world's top wrestling talent. Each Superstar has a special ability that can affect the game in their own unique way. Their abilities can be leveled up using our innovative Card Crafting system. In addition to their own abilities, you can also assign up to 4 (depending on the superstar) activate abilities from Ability Cards which can be found in Booster Packs.
There are five basic Momentum cards in our First Edition
If you're familiar with other Trading Card Games, you can compare Momentum cards to "Power Up" cards. These cards are used to raise your Superstar's Momentum (not exceeding their limits), which allows them to play Moves and Specials in a Ring Veteran match.
A Momentum card can be played as long the Superstar's ability momentum of that kind is not already at that Superstar's limit. When played, that ability's count is raised by 1, and the Superstar's total momentum and ability charge is also raised by 1.
Moves represent real wrestling maneuvers. A Move's cost is how much Momentum in total is needed to play the move, and the ability icons are the amount of specific ability Momentum needed to play the move. Once a player's Superstar has enough Momentum to execute a Move in a match, they can play the Move card on their turn.
When you play a Move, it doesn't connect until the opposing player passes the turn, but here's where it gets interesting. Certain Moves can counter other specific moves, or even whole entire move types. So the opposing player can choose to pass and let the move connect, or if he could use a playable Move in hand to counter your Move, which reverses the turn back to you.
A Move's damage is the base damage a move does when it connects. Each Move can have extra effects that affect the match and are described on the back of the card.
Specials are similar to Moves in what is necessary to play them. Unlike Moves, specials of certain modifiers can stay up over the course of the whole entire match.  Each Special have their own effects that affect the match and are described on the back of the card.
Every Trading Card Game includes cards that are so common that you end up having an abundant amount of scrap copies. Ring Veteran's innovative Card Crafting system puts all those scrap cards to good use.
One of the most exciting Ring Veteran features is the Craft Machine. By putting inserting cards in certain combinations into the Craft Machine, you can get all kinds of results! Below are some of the possibilities:
20 of the same cards - creates a foil version of that card.
any card below level 3  - levels up that card (based on a %).
random combinations - unpredictable results!
Certain combinations require Artifact type cards to be included. These Artifacts are included in boosters.
A basic Ring Veteran booster pack is worth .99 cents and contains 12 cards The cards are distributed in the following format:
6 Commons
2 Uncommons
1 (Rare, Legend, or Loaded Veteran Superstar)
3 Artifacts
Loaded Veteran Superstars can only be found in boosters, and come with 3 copies of each of their Trademark cards. The percentages for the Rare+ draws are as follows:
Rare - 88%
Legend - 11.95%
Loaded Veteran Superstar - .05%
Artifact cards can be used for Superstar Abilities, Crafting, and Player Customization.
Additionally for every booster there is a .40% chance that one of the cards will be a Foil Version (randomly chosen).
Another awesome aspect of Ring Veteran are Championship Belts. You can participate in weekly Championship tournaments and compete to become a Ring Veteran Champion!
Crowned champions will be awarded a Special title belt card. These title cards are exclusive to the champion, cannot be traded, and are usable in regular matches. Title belt vary in effects, and each effect is unique to their respective Championship. Do you have what it takes to become the very first Ring Veteran World Champion?
Live Market - You can buy and sell cards on the Live Market. Transactions here are made directly from player to player.
Crafting System - You can use the "machine" to smash your cards together to get impressive looking cards, like foil/shiny style cards. You can also use this machine to upgrade your cards to higher levels or better rarity cards.
Deck Builder - Here is where you will make and edit decks using your collection of cards that you've gathered through booster packs, prizes, achievements and the Live Market. You will select a superstar for each deck and add Momentum , Specials, and Moves.
Achievement System - The Achievement system is a way to show off your accomplishments in the game. Completing an achievement will yield points depending on the difficulty. Once you reach a points milestone you will be eligible to claim a reward. Do you have what it takes to get them all?
Automated Weekly Events - Who doesn't like events? We know everyone loves them, which is why we want to make sure you guys have them in abundance. Every week there will be several scheduled events going on. So get out there and win some tournaments!
Gauntlet Tournaments - If you aren't familiar with Trading Card Games, a Gauntlet Tournament can be compared to a "Booster Draft". Instead of opening Boosters, you are given a random set of cards, a few Superstars to pick from, and a set time to quickly create the deck that you are going to use for the tournament. You must use this deck for the remainder of the tournament, which may vary formats.
Mobile Support - Ring Veteran will be coming to all Android and IOS devices!
The following features will be part of our stretch goal bonuses. We will post our stretch goals soon.
Backstage Match - One match type that we have been eager to add is the Backstage Match. In this match type, you will be able to use the environment as well as different weapons to get an advantage to crush your opponent! What will be your favorite weapon of choice? Decide wisely!
Backstage Area - To go along side the Backstage Match, we will be building a whole new area so you can explore it first hand without being in the match, get a feel for the area so you know what to expect when you play the Match. 
Positioning Server (For out of match player interaction) - Who doesn't want to walk around and catch up with their friends? Maybe you would come across someone you don't like, why not throw him into the ring and show him who the better man is!
Mini External Events - External events are outside of the game-play, in the open world aka arena. These events will be very fun, and include scavenger hunts, trivia, races, etc. Be on your toes, there is no telling which event will be happening or when!
Tag Team Matches - Do you have a friend you like to play with? Do you think you two are the best? Well then this is your type of match, get your friend ready to face two other people and go head to head! Along with this match, there will also be a new belt available to win! Do you have what it takes?
3-Way Matches - Maybe you're good enough to defeat one player, but what happens when you have to face two at the same time in an all for all, triple threat environment? Yourself and two other players going toe to toe, will you be able to handle this really difficult match?
4 Man Battle Royal Match - Similar to the Triple Threat match, 4-way matches will be against four different people, in a free for all style match. There can only be one victor, will it be you?
30 Man Over the Top Battle Royal Match - This match will consist of 30 players, it will be a regular match AND a special event type match. Do you think you have what it takes to go through 29 other people and come out on top? There will be special rewards to those players who are able to make it to the top!
Create Your Own Wrestler- In this mode, you create your own Wrestler card, and engage in matches against other created Wrestlers. The match format is a completely different game mode. While still using Ring Veteran move cards, this mode opens up a different perspective where your decisions are situational, and cards available to you are based on your wrestler's stats. By playing matches, you are awarded experience points that would be used to level up your wrestler. Each level up will award stat points which can be used to boost your wrestler's stats, and unlock more options that become available in your matches.
Our VIP Program is a monthly subscription that costs $5.00 per month. The benefits of being a VIP member range from, but are not limited to:
Special discounts on releases
VIP exclusive mini events
VIP exclusive events for real-life prizes
VIP exclusive player customization items
Redeem one free booster per week (does not stack)
                             We are set to release Alpha 1 on February 14th, 2015.
Ring Veteran will release 1 major card set per year, followed by 3 smaller themed sets per year. Major sets will range for 300-350 cards including 10 Superstars, and smaller sets will range from 80-150 cards including 3-5 Superstars.
The very first Ring Veteran set is called First Edition

Renowned relationship expert Dr. Antonio Borrello teams up with his ex-wife to write book uncovering the ultimate relationship and dating hacks for the new digital world.
Psychologist and relationship therapist Dr. Antonio Borrello and his ex-wife, psychologist Dr. Theresa Pavone, have officially codified their exhilarating and sometimes-frustrating experiences in the new digital world of dating in a new book, Relationships 2.0.
After three years of navigating the tumultuous “new world” of online dating, Antonio and Theresa did what any divorced couple would do – they joined forces to share the ultimate dating hacks they had learned. This unlikely duo has written a revolutionary new book, Relationships 2.0.
Married in the Vatican and divorced in Detroit, the couple spent three long years re-learning the dating game, a game that has radically changed. Exhilarating and often frustrating, dating is not what it once was just 10 years ago. Tinder, mobile dating apps, online dating – all of these have changed the dating scene irrevocably.
“We grappled with some primitive, powerful feelings as we shared stories and compared notes. Somewhere in there, we realized we’d uncovered unique dating perspectives that could save others from so much frustration and hurt,” explains Dr. Borrello. “Combining our psychological background, our unique perspective as a divorced coupe and the new rules of online and mobile engagement, we were able to discover dating hacks that can help anyone searching for love today.”
Bringing a unique relationships perspective never shared before, Relationships 2.0 will enable anyone to understand difficult dating or relationship situations and the changes necessary to improve their relationships.
It helps you understand why those failed relationships failed, teaches you how you can avoid repeating mistakes of the past, and guides you through handling common dating challenges. It’s a tool that will help you prepare for the happy, healthy relationship of your dreams.
This book is for those of us who have at some point declared that dating sucks. It’s for those of us who just can’t seem to find The One. And, most especially, this book is for those who have struggled but still believe in second chances—the 2.0.

First Update and Answer to the question,
"Wasn't it weird to write a dating and relationship book with your ex-wife?"
Click on the Play button to Listen.
As a psychologist and relationship therapist, Dr. Antonio Borrello had spent more than ten years working with thousands of people to improve and heal their most important relationships. His scientific background and passion for helping people led Antonio to become a recognized dating and relationship expert. It even inspired him to begin writing his first book ... Until he got divorced. Suddenly, Antonio was forced to reevaluate every aspect of his personal life and professional practice. After all, who ever heard of a divorced marriage therapist?
Like most divorcing couples with children, Antonio and his ex-wife Dr. Theresa Pavone struggled through a difficult adjustment period. Married or not, they were both determined to redefine their relationship and successfully uncouple. Through patience, understanding, hard work, and a little bit of luck, Antonio and Theresa were able to develop a new co-parenting friendship that is mutually rewarding and beneficial to their children.
Eventually, they also began to meet new people and rediscover the whole dating process, this time with the help of modern technology— texting, getting asked out on Facebook, setting up online dating accounts—all the excitement and craziness the digital age can possibly offer. It has certainly been a wild ride so far, and now, three years later, Antonio and Theresa have come together to co-author the new book Relationships 2.0, revealing everything they have discovered since they ventured back into the exhilarating and occasionally frustrating world of single-hood, and of course, imparting some of their wisdom from their many years in the field of psychology.
If you thought it was hard trying to write an authoritative book on relationships after going through a divorce, try and imagine the "Mission: Impossible" nature of writing this book with a co-author who also happens to be the ex-wife in question! I'd be lying if I said didn't find myself grappling with some primitive, powerful feelings as she told me about her recent dating experiences as we compared notes on our dating experiences to write this book. A lot of authors will tell you they wrote their book from the heart and where Relationships 2.0 is concerned, truer words were never spoken.
Relationships 2.0 is a book I wish I would have had a long time ago. It’s filled with very easy to understand explanations of the most relevant relationship theories and research collected over the past decades.
With Relationships 2.0, anyone will be able to understand difficult dating or relationship situations and the changes that are necessary to improve their relationships.
